boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





The official parkour game of STORROR, a world renowned parkour team.User Summary
boardgame.videogameversion: Live Xbox Series X downloadable edition

boardgame.name: Kingdoms of the Deep
boardgame.description:
While the battle for the five kingdoms rages above the ground, there is also unrest and conflict happening below the surface. In Kingdoms of the Deep, you control six underwater factions and vie to control the most underwater territories, while gaining the most influence to call yourself ruler of the Underwater Realms.

Kingdoms of the Deep is an area control and simultaneous action selection game for 1-6 players that plays in about an hour. Balance deploying your aquatic forces across the capitals of Atlantis with fulfilling specific goals while also trying to be the only player to choose a specific action each round.

Each round, players choose their actions simultaneously, then reveal. Players then take their turns in turn order and get a bonus if they are the one that round to choose that specific action.

Players gain reputation (points) by fulfilling round goals that and having the majorities in the capital tiles during the scoring rounds.

When at least one player has played the Reset action in a round, the game tracker advances. Once the game tracker advances 9 times, the game is over and the final scoring happens!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Creatures of the Tomb
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Haunting new creatures have been unearthed in this tome of nightmares!

This sourcebook contains over 150 pages of new creatures with balanced statblocks and art, ready to invade your haunting campaigns and oneshot adventures. The main aim of this product is to provide more interesting options for undead, beasts, and monstrosities then those presented in the Monster Manual. It also contains 10 battle maps (DM & Player versions) that can be used as an additional resource.

boardgame.name: Age of Defense
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Age of Defense is tower defense game with cute graphics and some new features.Ancient world is really dangerous. You must protect your women and food from any misfortunes. In this reality dinosaurs have evolved differently. They can think, speak, make war! You are the ruler of an ancient tribe. Your people are hungry and scared. You must protect them from scaleskins' threat.

Features


Marvelous mix of fantasy and history
24 unique towers with 68 buyable upgrades
Over 100 enemies with various abilities
No buildfields! You can place towers anywhere you want
The path is blockable. You can put obstacles on the road to gather enemies and kill them with one deadful ability


AoD is tower defense game with some new features. First of all, real size monsters cannot go through each other. Don't let your enemy achieve his goal by building towers and creating obstacles on the path. In addition, there is an extensive choice of towers with incredible abilities. What do you prefer? A big monkey with bouncing poison bones or a belligerent woman who throws exploding flowers while balancing on a huge rainbow toad? Choose your favorites, make important upgrades in the skills tree and lead your wildmen to the enemy land in order to reveal the secret of scaleskin hostility!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Adaptable NPCs of the Guild
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enrich the adventures you tell with new non-player characters to guide your players across Faerûn!

Adaptable NPCs of the Guild is a DMs Guild community project that introduces you to detailed non-player characters to use at your table. Quest givers, travelling companions, minor henchmen, or campaign ending foes await to engage your players and inspire your campaigns.

Written by 18 of the Guild's most talented and exciting creators, this book provides you with NPCs to populate your worlds! From the Retired Red Wizard of Thay to the Chosen Disciples of Tiamat, these NPCs will fit perfectly into your official campaign settings or homebrew worlds alike!

Additionally, a completely original 12-page adventure has been included that can be run standalone or dropped into an official campaign setting using one of the many included story hooks.

boardgame.name: Disturbed Graves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seeking dominance over the undead? Need some minions to do your bidding?

Get ready for the ultimate class to Raise the Dead!

Included in Disturbed Graves:

The Pale Master, a fully-fledged class for 5th Edition D&D.


Unique Intelligence-based 3/4 caster class

Interesting summonable undead creatures, each ready to do your bidding (skeletons & zombies are taking a backseat)!
Five (5) lore-packed archtypes (called elegies), including: Decay, Dread, Enduring, Revenge, and Twilight
Amazing custom artwork throughout the supplement, created by the amazingly talented Bob Greyvenstein
Inspiration from the UA Artificer, spun in a new direction with Macabre Creations: unsettling magical items ready for the pale master to craft!

Additional player options not exclusive to Pale Masters in the form of Undead Grafts:
Twenty (20) Undead Grafts that can be obtained by any class, not just Pale Masters
Rules (and costs) for putting undead grafts into your campaign
Descriptions & lore for each graft!
Heavily inspired by Libris Mortis (3.5e) and Open Graves (4e). Many of the items & graft contained with in this supplement were converted into 5th Edition from these works!

boardgame.name: Fundamental Feats
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new philosophy and rule for feats in *5th Edition Dungeons and Dragons* as well as a whole heap of new and old feats reworked for the world's greatest roleplaying game!

What is it?

A new rule for feats that makes them integral to 5th edition player characters without breaking the game!
Twenty-eight NEW and revitalized feats to expand your group's library of balanced 5th edition feats.

boardgame.name: Untamed Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unleash your innate power with reckless abandon!

A sorcerer unable to contain its innate primal fury sees this power manifest itself as a lightning bolt is expelled from their chest... Such is the struggle of those trying to control untamed magic!

Untamed Magic completely rewrites the wild magic sorcerer archetype to amazing effect! Now called the Untamed Magic sorcerer, no longer is the Dungeon Master required to micromanage when the player rolls on the Surge table - it is now fully in the player's hands! Also, the chaotic nature of their magic has an influence on their spell lists.

Inside the pages of this supplement, you will find:

Base sorcerer class, reprinted for ease of use
The Untamed Magic sorcerer archetype, a completely rewritten wild magic sorcerer
A complete Untamed Magic Surge table, with 100 unique effects
Option to introduce Wild Magic Zones into your campaign
Wild Magic options & tables for all classes, employable when characters use class features in Wild Magic Zones
Over 20 pieces of unique art!

boardgame.name: Hired Help
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hired Help takes the hireling rules presented in Shadow of the Demon Lord and develops them further to provide groups with the tools they need to create interesting, compelling, and useful companions. This supplement introduces guidelines for hiring, loyalty, and morale, offers ways to vary the numbers and grant new talents, traits, and more, while also providing tools for building hireling statistics from scratch. As with all supplements in the Poisoned Pages series, everything here is considered optional and before you put these rules into play, you should discuss the material with your group to determine if it’s appropriate for your campaigns.

boardgame.name: Sicherman's War
boardgame.description: In this take on traditional war, teams divide troops (a standard 52 card deck) into units for battles. There are also reinforcements. Battles are played using similar principles from the traditional war card game, but with a twist! Each player will command a pair of Sicherman dice, as well as a single standard d6, to aid his troops in battle, strategically affecting the outcomes to overwhelm their opponent. The game relies on luck, risk, probability, and strategy. Points are accumulated as spoils to see who wins the war! Sicherman's War has both a 2 player and a 4 player variant.

boardgame.name: Builders of China
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





City builder set in ancient China.User Summary

boardgame.name: Three Blind Dice
boardgame.description: Three blind Dice is a game that includes rolling 4 total dice: 1 standard pair of 6-sided dice, and 1 pair of Sicherman dice. One dice is revealed and three are hidden. Using your logic and reasoning, deduce what the three hidden dice are by asking the right questions. Each dice guessed is points in your favor. Be the player to earn the most points and you win! Three Blind Dice is a free pdf rulesheet game that implements Sicherman Dice.

boardgame.name: Builders of Greece
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





City builder set in Ancient Greece.User Summary

boardgame.name: Sichy
boardgame.description: Sichy is a dice game that features 1 pair of standard 6-sided dice and 1 pair of Sicherman dice. Before the dice are rolled, players each need to write down their guesses- guessing the results of the dice. Guesses are based on the logic of probabilities, and the fun of different dice. Successful guesses grant different points, based on the difficulty of the successful prediction.

boardgame.name: Heroes of Aedrenar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Aedrenar! A New Post-Apocalyptic Fantasy World full of adventure, designed for masked vigilantes and treasure hunters alike!

Do you regularly descend into the more lawless districts of Vestholm to fight crime? Is there a wing of a local asylum fully dedicated to mad criminals you've brought to justice? Are you the target of a hidden council of rich sociopaths who control the city with fear? If so, you may have contracted 'Vigilantism'! There is only one cure to make sure you dont perish.

This book is that cure.

Heroes of Aedrenar is a sourcebook for the Aedrenar Campaign Setting, which details new rules for creating powerful heroes, new feats and traits, and some details on Vestholm's most notorious crime-fighters!

boardgame.name: Snow & Ice
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the snowy and icy lands in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Rescue Mission: Deadly Combat (Monsters! Monsters! Version)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your mission is simple: the son of an Uruk clan chieftain has been captured by ruthless human sea raiders, and you've been sent to rescue him. All you need to do is avoid being eaten by dire wolves, build a seaworthy boat, and infiltrate an island full of pirates--either that or just lead an outnumbered attack on the fiercest group of sea wolves in the western ocean. This is another minor adventure on Trollworld written by Ken St. Andre, the creator of Tunnels & Trolls and its spinoff game, Monsters! Monsters! Ken says this sort of thing happens on Trollworld all the time.

boardgame.name: Stone of Shaitan
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mysterious Ship

The cargo ship Stone of Shaitan may be involved in smuggling illegal goods—and something far more sinister. When heroes investigate the disappearance of the ship's crew, they discover clues to a mysterious cult, occult secrets, a being known only as "The Old Fellow," and a scheme to loose eldritch horrors upon the world! Stone of Shaitan stands on its own or can be a "sequel" of sorts to the classic Icons adventure Danger in Dunsmouth.

boardgame.name: The Toppled King
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hex 15.22 is another in the Basilisk Hills cluster of 6-mile Populated Hexes. It features a fallen statue of Zaphisdreal the Mighty -- a king of old -- a giant ant colony, and a young dragon, among other threats. Additionally, it provides rules for making dragons more interesting. This hex uses Old School Essentials but can be easily adapted to any OSR-style game.

boardgame.name: Kill the Beast!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 3-chapter adventure intended for a party of 5 to 6 adventurers of 3rd level.

Kill the Beast!

A bit of lore: Mr. Bernard was attacked by a werewolf on his way back home. He became cursed with lycanthropy and he attacks his former home when he turns into a beast. People in Lutton Thorp miss him. But they have no way to link the attacks with the missing merchant.

The heroes arrive after the second attack to the thorp. The villagers are scared and offer what they can to get their help. The adventurers might take a different approach when they learn the truth, if they care to look for it.

boardgame.name: Thunderbolt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The team is hired by a retired starship captain to revisit the site of a great past battle and salvage one of the weapons that helped turn the tide. Finding the item is difficult enough, but things get even more complicated when the PCs find themselves up against a clan leader who refuses to divulge the location of the weapon even as he struggles with the guilt of the damage it did during the war. Can the PCs successfully outmaneuver the ghosts of those the leader sent to an early grave to claim the prize?

Thunderbolt is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: The Shadow of Our Burden
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A call for help from an old friend leads to his death, and the heroes forced to protect a powerful telepath who’s bearing a deadly secret. As the forces deployed to kill her close in, the team must decipher the shattered pieces of her mind to determine where to take her to safety. But the most startling secret is the nature of who is trying to end her life and that of the team’s!

The Shadow of Our Burden is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: Cyber Manhunt
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Hacker game with puzzle elements.'User Summary

boardgame.name: The Magical Land of Yeld: Quest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yeld: Quest is a source book for solo adventures in the magical land of Yeld!

Discover the secret door to Yeld and set out on a brand new adventure, with only your pet at your side! Yeld: Quest includes new rules and guidelines for 1 Player and 1 Game Master to explore the magical land of Yeld!

In Yeld: Quest you’ll find:

New rules and guidelines for adventures in Yeld with 1 Player and 1 Gamemaster! Start an adventure with your partner, child, parent or best friend!
Introducing Pets, faithful companions that will join your quest and grow as you explore Yeld!
Insult Monsters and cheer on your Friends and Pets with Dialogue, a dynamic new option for fights! Use Dialogue in both Quest and traditional Yeld adventures!
30 new Special dice designed just for Quest (but usable in traditional Yeld adventures), including 8 new Job specific dice, Pet dice and Dialogue dice!
3 new Mentors to guide you on your journey!
Introducing the Rival, a troublemaking character that will grow along side you as you journey through Yeld, and may become your Nemesis!

boardgame.name: The Necroknight Compendium
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deliver Death By Sword And Spell

Mix swordplay and dark sorcery with the necroknight! Revised for Pathfinder 1st edition, and expanded with base classes for Pathfinder 2nd edition and Starfinder! Bolster your lifeforce with necromancy to keep the fight going, and watch your foes wither against your power! Dive into the various aspects and specialties of necromancy with the necroknight’s necromantic focus; special paths that grant unique powers!

Includes

Necroknight for Pathfinder 1st Edition: The original, prettied up and ready to grace your next game session! Revised from LRGG’s Tome of Ethical Necromancy, we’ve included 7 necromantic focuses, 2 archetypes (the phantom knight and the dark chi warrior), and 4 class support feats!
Necroknight for Pathfinder 2nd Edition: Enjoy the necroknight in Paizo’s latest system! With 50+ class feats including special necromantic focus feats, 6 new focus spells, and even multiclass feats!
Necroknight for Starfinder: A dark magic swordsman for the space age! Enjoy 7 necromantic focuses, and 20 dark secret talents to help customize your necroknight!

boardgame.name: Chinese Empire
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





City builder strategy game set in Ancient China.User Summary

boardgame.name: Cloud Gardens
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Help nature retake wasteland.User Summary

boardgame.name: Christmas Trees for Sail
boardgame.description:
Winter, 1904: Christmas settles on the shores of Lake Michigan like snow on a Fraser fir, and with it arrives the glorious Christmas Tree Ship.

Every year, the Christmas Tree Ship sailed North from Chicago to purchase trees from farmers in Michigan and Wisconsin, then returned to sell them in the big city.

In Christmas Trees for Sail, players become holiday mirth merchants, sailing to and fro buying trees, selling them for profit, then using those profits to bring Christmas Cheer to Chicago’s needy children.

Press your luck as you brave the wind and waves, sailing North to find cheaper trees while hoping to avoid the nasty weather. Good luck... and Merry Christmas!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kingly Knights & Knifing Knaves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A comedic, ribald & risqué town adventure for Four Against Darkness, for levels 3-4

Shamelessly mocking Lysistrata and Romeo and Juliet, Kingly Knights & Knifing Knaves is a hilarious and lewd commedia dell’arte town adventure where the townswomen hold a sex strike to convince their bellicose husbands to lay town their arms, to no avail. Will you restore peace, take a side, or just kill everyone and loot their gold?

Featuring new classes (Cavalier, Flamingelf, Flamingo Folk, Harlot Skunk Folk & Swain), Craft skills for all classes, new Character Traits, magic flamingo retainers, new rules to play in town and very, very naughty events you shouldn’t tell your mother about.

Contains lewd art, silliness, flamingos and adult stuff.

boardgame.name: Travelers
boardgame.description:
Travelers is a lightweight abstract strategy game for 2 players, designed for ultra-portability. This pocketable game can be played on tiny cafe tables or on the banks of a river!

Players each control four pieces and vie to control the four hexagonal tiles that make up the board.

On your turn, you take one of three actions: Move one of your tokens, rotate one of the hexagonal tiles, or move a tile to match the colors of a face-up domino.

Win by having one of your pieces on all four hexagonal tiles OR by collecting more dominos than your opponent.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Parma Calcio Manager
boardgame.description:
Parma Calcio Manager is a game in which players, in the role of coaches, face off in a series of football matches.

It is the official board game of the Parma Calcio 1913 team

Create your team during the Transfer Market then challenge your opponents: will you play defensively or will you risk everything to find the Goal?
Climb the leaderboard by beating your opponents and managing the unexpected.
Will you be able to win the Championship?

boardgame.name: Speedstream
boardgame.description:
In Speedstream, up to six pilots compete in their superfast vehicles on a hi-tech track.

The main goal is, as always, to be first, but in Speedstream being first is not an easy task, but can be achieved by any means necessary. Staying first is even harder.

Players have full control over their vehicles starting from statistics to behavior on track. You can go slow and safe and never roll a dice, or push your luck and attack aggressively, and put your fate on a dice roll.

Take corners fast and risk losing control over speeder! Push your opponents on track wall, to slow them down or even destroy. Fight your way to the first place using extra equipment for your vehicle like shields, tractor beams, EMP discharges, or even seeking missiles. All means necessary allowed!

Each player pilots one speeder, steering it through obstacles, blocking other players, and collecting boosts. Speeders are customizable, and during the progress of the game they get upgrades, and the player decides how to tune the vehicle. Board is modular, allowing players to build unique tracks for each game.

There are also sponsors available, giving additional upgrades to your speeders. Lots of negative but fair play interaction between players, course-plotting, and risk-taking. Speeders can be damaged and even crashed, but even then you can still get to the end line first.

This is a downloadable product, to be printed and cut on an A3 format paper or cardboard sheet. It still needs additional elements like tokens, dice, and speeders models.

—description from the publisher’s website

boardgame.name: Cronocartes: Història de Catalunya
boardgame.description:
Cronocartes: Història de Catalunya ("Cronocards: History of Catalonia") is a card game with Catalan history theme. Each card has an image and a text that represents a key point or achievement in the Catalan history, art, gastronomy or culture.
The front and back of each card are identical except for the fact that the back of the card include also the year in which the event happened.

Each player is given 7 cards face up so that the year is not visible to them.
One card is then placed face down (so that the year is visible) on the table.
Each player, in his/her turn, will place one of his/her cards face up before, after or between the cards already in the table and then turn it faced down so that the year is visible. If the card has been correctly placed chronologically, the card remains on the table, otherwise, the card is discarded and the player takes another card. The first player to finish the cards wins.

For an additional degree of difficulty, instead of discarded an incorrectly placed cards, leave it on the table face down (with the year visible) in its correct position.

This is a standalone game, but is fully compatible with similar games such as Timeline series and can be combined with them.

[Catalan translation]

Cronocartes: Història de Catalunya és un joc de cartes de temàtica històrica.
Cada carta té una imatge i un text que representa un esdeveniment o fita a la història, art, gastronomia o cultura catalanes. L'anvers i el revers de cada carta són idèntics excepte pel fet que a l'anvers figura l'any en què va ocórrer l'esdeveniment que fa referència la carta.

Es reparteixen 7 cartes a cada jugador sense que se'n vegi l'any. Després es posa una carta a la taula mostrant el revers (cara amb l'any de l'esdeveniment).
Cada jugador, al seu torn, posa una de les seves cartes abans, després o entre dues de les cartes que hi ha a la taula sense que se'n vegi l'any. Seguidament gira la carta per mostrar l'any. Si la carta s'ha col·locat correctament
(cronològicament), la carta roman a la taula. Si no es descarta la carta i el jugador agafa una altra carta nova. El primer jugador a acabar les seves cartes guanya.

Si voleu fer el joc una mica més difícil, en comptes de descartar la carta mal col·locada, deixeu-la al seu lloc cronològicament correcte.

Cronocartes és un joc complet, però completament compatible amb jocs similars com els jocs de la sèrie Timeline, pel que es pot combinar amb ells.

boardgame.name: Lethargy Hill
boardgame.description: Horror

boardgame.name: Deadly Fame
Dernier Acte
Tödlicher Ruhm
boardgame.description:
During the premiere, Juliet thrusts a stage dagger into herself on stage in front of a full house. As Juliet dies, it becomes clear – Somebody must have switched the prop with a real dagger.

Welcome to the exciting world of Minebury City Theater! You have all been working towards this premiere for a long time: “Romeo and Juliet” by William Shakespeare.

But the production seems ill-fated. Patrick was rejected a few weeks ago when he asked Juliet’s hand in marriage. As a result, everyone was anxious to see how it would turn out when the two lead actors appeared on stage together. At first the premiere seemed to run smoothly. At 8:00 pm, the curtain rose in front of a full house. The play lasted three hours including the intermission.

At the end of the play, at 11:00 pm, the tragedy occurred: Juliet had picked up the stage dagger behind the stage from among the other props. She dramatically thrust the blade into her body. At first the audience was enthralled by her impressive performance. But when Patrick saw Juliet’s blood and called out for a doctor, the audience realized what they had just witnessed was in fact a real tragedy: Somebody had switched the stage dagger with a real knife.

Arriving shortly after, the emergency services could do nothing but pronounce Juliet dead at the scene. The question is: which of the people present is responsible for Juliet’s gruesome death?

What is a murder mystery game?

You and your guests slip into the roles of the main suspects of an exciting murder case. The objective of the game is to convict the perpetrator – one of the people sitting with you at the table. This can only be achieved if the players discuss the course of events amongst themselves and compare their experiences of what happened. But be careful: Each character (including you!) has their own dark secrets which they’d be better off keeping to themselves.

You all gather in the wake of the crime and attempt to piece together your memories, with the aim of identifying the perpetrator. In each round, you recall more and more about the circumstances of the crime, as each round deals with a different period of time from the evening the crime was committed. At the end, everyone votes on who should be handed over to the police as the suspect.

Culinario Mortale is a highly interactive game. There are only a few rules, and no pre-prepared dialogue. The focus is on working through the puzzles and discussing the events together.

Alongside a well-structured game manual, each game contains game booklets for between five and eight characters (the number of players for each game can be found on the packaging and here on our website). In the game booklets, each guest will find their personal clues and a description of their role. Each game booklet also includes a brief overview of how the game works. As such, all players can jump right in. The support code included with your Culinario Mortale game will allow you to download the role descriptions in advance from our website in PDF format, and easily send them to your guests via email.

GAME CONTENT:
1 Game Manual, 8 Game Booklets, 1 Incident Booklet (includes of prologue, incidents, solution), 8 name badges, 1 support code

— description from the publisher.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Murder Mystery Games (Culinario Mortale Inc.)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Mord nach Rezept
Mort à la carte
A Recipe for Death
boardgame.description:
It was New Year’s Eve at the luxurious restaurant, The Osgood, which sits majestically atop a mountain ridge above a posh ski resort town in the Rocky Mountains. It had been snowing heavily since the morning, and the three-star chef George Osgood had closed his renowned establishment, as he did every year, in order to celebrate with his family and employees in an intimate setting.

At 63, George wanted to retire in the new year. That’s why he announced that he would be revealing his successor this evening. Everyone was awaiting his decision with bated breath.

The two chefs, Marcus and Henry, both vying to be George’s successor, served an impressive four-course menu. Everyone ate and drank copious amounts. The evening promised to be an unforgettable one.

To everyone’s surprise, George did not announce his successor during dinner, but by midnight, when the New Year was due to be welcomed with a glass of champagne on the terrace, the evening has taken an unfortunate turn. As the fireworks display over Aspen Mountain started flaring up on the horizon, the renowned chef was found dead on the terrace. Judging by the position of his body, somebody had thrown him head first over the balcony.

The police were informed immediately. Because of the heavy snow, they will not reach the on-mountain restaurant for another few hours. Until the authorities arrive, you are all on your own in solving the mystery. What happened this evening? How could this New Year’s celebration have ended so tragically?

What is a murder mystery game?

You and your guests slip into the roles of the main suspects of an exciting murder case. The objective of the game is to convict the perpetrator – one of the people sitting with you at the table. This can only be achieved if the players discuss the course of events amongst themselves and compare their experiences of what happened. But be careful: Each character (including you!) has their own dark secrets which they’d be better off keeping to themselves.

You all gather in the wake of the crime and attempt to piece together your memories, with the aim of identifying the perpetrator. In each round, you recall more and more about the circumstances of the crime, as each round deals with a different period of time from the evening the crime was committed. At the end, everyone votes on who should be handed over to the police as the suspect.

Culinario Mortale is a highly interactive game. There are only a few rules, and no pre-prepared dialogue. The focus is on working through the puzzles and discussing the events together.

Alongside a well-structured game manual, each game contains game booklets for between five and eight characters (the number of players for each game can be found on the packaging and here on our website). In the game booklets, each guest will find their personal clues and a description of their role. Each game booklet also includes a brief overview of how the game works. As such, all players can jump right in. The support code included with your Culinario Mortale game will allow you to download the role descriptions in advance from our website in PDF format, and easily send them to your guests via email.

GAME CONTENT:

boardgame.name: Expedition in den Tod
Expedition of Death
boardgame.description:
This expedition in the Peruvian jungle uncovered a real sensation – The royal priestesses’ burial chamber. But while the excavation team were still busy celebrating their success in the evening, the famous archaeology professor Mary Stonerock was found dead.

You had expected this expedition to be nothing less than an archaeological miracle. For two months, you’ve all been in the Peruvian rainforest looking for the remains of the Moche people, an advanced South American civilization that preceded the Incas and has hardly been studied.

You knew you were on the right path, as you had found countless small vases, tools and other artifacts over the past few days. Late in the afternoon, you finally found the tomb of the priestesses. This important find would have been another milestone in the career of Mary Stonerock, the US’s youngest full professor of archaeology.

Mary decided to celebrate the find with a hearty feast and an evening of drinking. You raised a toast to your joint success and speculated as to what the tomb, to be opened the next day, might contain. But the evening took a tragic turn when Christian discovered Mary’s body at around midnight in the entrance of her tent.

Director Gustavo Navarro has since notified the police using the camp’s radio. They are due to arrive at the remote excavation site in a few hours. Until they are here, you are all on your own in solving the mystery. What happened? How could this expedition have ended so tragically?

What is a murder mystery game?

You and your guests slip into the roles of the main suspects of an exciting murder case. The objective of the game is to convict the perpetrator – one of the people sitting with you at the table. This can only be achieved if the players discuss the course of events amongst themselves and compare their experiences of what happened. But be careful: Each character (including you!) has their own dark secrets which they’d be better off keeping to themselves.

You all gather in the wake of the crime and attempt to piece together your memories, with the aim of identifying the perpetrator. In each round, you recall more and more about the circumstances of the crime, as each round deals with a different period of time from the evening the crime was committed. At the end, everyone votes on who should be handed over to the police as the suspect.

Culinario Mortale is a highly interactive game. There are only a few rules, and no pre-prepared dialogue. The focus is on working through the puzzles and discussing the events together.

Alongside a well-structured game manual, each game contains game booklets for between five and eight characters (the number of players for each game can be found on the packaging and here on our website). In the game booklets, each guest will find their personal clues and a description of their role. Each game booklet also includes a brief overview of how the game works. As such, all players can jump right in. The support code included with your Culinario Mortale game will allow you to download the role descriptions in advance from our website in PDF format, and easily send them to your guests via email.

GAME CONTENT:
1 Game Manual, 7 Game Booklets, 1 Incident Booklet (includes of prologue, incidents, solution), 7 name badges, 1 support code

— description from the publisher.

Schatten über Landsitz Hagenberg
Shadow Over Westongrove Manor
boardgame.description:
The family patriarch and rich businessman Anthony Westongrove had invited his children to the grand family manor to celebrate his 70th birthday yesterday.

All of the family members arrived at the manor on Friday afternoon, and an extravagant feast was served at 7:00 pm. It promised to be a wonderful evening …

But the birthday celebration came to an unpleasant end when Anthony was rushed to the hospital during the night after falling very ill. Concerned, the entire family stayed at Westongrove Manor and waited for the patriarch to make his return. Today, on Saturday afternoon, Anthony was finally released from the hospital. His unconsciousness turned out to be caused by poisoning. It would appear that one of the guests was after his blood.

Anthony wishes to resolve the matter within the family, which is why everyone who was present has come together again this evening. The question is: What happened yesterday night? Who tried to kill Westongrove?

boardgame.name: Un Corps à la Mer
Mord über Bord
Murder Overboard
boardgame.description:
The successful start-up founder Max Hubbard invited his school friends on a yacht trip. Everyone was reminiscing about old memories until the evening took a tragic turn. Max’s wife Eleanor suddenly disappeared without a trace.

Max’s invitation to join him on a yacht trip came as a surprise. Your old circle from school hadn’t met up for two years. Since then, your lives had slowly drifted in different directions. The reunions had been less and less frequent.

Max had rented a luxurious motor yacht, with its own captain and cook, and late in the afternoon the vessel left the harbor. Antonio, the chef, served a fantastic five-course dinner in the evening. The champagne corks popped and everybody raised a glass to good times in the past. Everyone had plenty of stories to tell.

But the trip took a dramatic turn in the course of the night. By the time Max went to bed at around midnight, his wife Ella had disappeared. Max alerted everyone, and you all searched the ship from stem to stern. At first everyone thought it was a prank. But when you found a pool of blood on deck, it was clear something bad must have happened.

Captain Steward has notified the police and Coast Guard, but there is little hope of finding Ella alive. Until the authorities arrive, you will have to solve the mystery by yourselves. What happened this evening? Has there been a murder on board?

boardgame.name: Meurtre au Prestige Hôtel
Mord im Grand Hotel
Murder at the Grand Hotel
boardgame.description:
During the ceremonial opening of the New York Grand Hotel the actress Monique Moreau is found dead in her suite. How could the opening celebration end so tragically?

New York, August 1962. Welcome to the city that never sleeps! Everybody who was anybody had come to Manhattan to celebrate the opening of the magnificent Grand Hotel – aspiring politicians, powerful industrialists and beautiful actresses. The largest luxury hotel in the United States was set on redefining the term “five-star”, and was also to be the crown jewel in the empire of Frederic Price. The hotel tycoon was one of the richest men in the country. Since his marriage to the actress Dóra Galor, he was now even better known than before.

The opening speeches were full of praise, and the guests ate and drank copious amounts from the five-course menu. The evening had all the hallmarks of an incredible coming-together of American high society. Once the official part of the event was over, the guests gathered for an exuberant cocktail party at the longest hotel bar in the entire city. But the evening took a tragic turn when the young actress Monique Moreau was found dead in the bathtub of her hotel suite late in the evening. The idea that the young woman, described by the media as the next Dóra Galor, would take her own life is rejected by everyone as incredible.

The police were informed immediately. But it will take the authorities hours to search the entire hotel and secure all the relevant evidence. You have all been requested to stay here in the lobby. Until the police have questioned everybody, you are all on your own in solving the mystery, asking the questions: what happened this evening? How could the opening celebration end so tragically?

boardgame.name: Painting Parlay
boardgame.description:
Painting Parlay is an educational game meant to teach the world's greatest artists, increase visual literacy for art, and identify elements of style. Players can vote if their opponents are correct, leading to a fun exploration of the arts.

Objective: Be the player or team with the most points after each player’s or team’s five cards have been placed with an artist. For a quick version of Painting Parlay use three cards instead of five.

Set-Up:
Layout the sixteen artists in a four by four grid on the table.
Shuffle the large square art cards and deal 5 cards to each player or team. Be sure not to look at the back of the art cards, as the artist is revealed on the backside of the card.
Place the small hint cards painting side up, next to the artist grid, players can search the hint deck for a painting.
Each player or team will take a voting card, and a point card with a clip to track their points.

Rules:
On your turn, you will choose a painting in your hand, examine its style and elements, and compare it to the sixteen artists on the table.
You will then place your card with whom you think painted this painting, and give a brief reason on why you came to that conclusion.

Hints and Help:
If you are lost and need help you can search the hint deck for your painting, you will get fewer points if you choose correctly, however it will give you its date of creation, and information about the painting or artist.
Artist Information: At any time on your turn, you can flip one artist card and read a brief summary of their life.
Exchanging Your Painting: Once per game you or your team can switch one of the paintings in your hand with one of the top three paintings of the art card deck. You will take your new painting and discard the painting in your hand.

Once you have chosen who you think painted your painting, the other players will vote, flipping their voting card to a check or an x, on whether they think you guessed correctly or incorrectly. Then flip the art card, and reveal the artist.

If you placed your painting next to the correct artist you will receive a point amount based on whether you used a hint or not. Adjust your scorecard using the sliding clip on the card. If you guessed incorrectly, you receive no points.
Your turn ends and the next player seeks to match their painting with an artist.

Point Values:
Placed Painting Next to Correct Artist without a Hint: 5 points
Placed Painting Next to Correct Artist with a Hint: 3 points
If you voted correctly what the outcome would be: 2 points

Players continue to place their paintings with an artist until everyone has placed five of their paintings. In the quick version of Painting Parlay, it is only three paintings that are placed with an artist for the game to end.

Look at your scorecard and see who has the most points, that player or team is the winner! Congratulations on your mastery of the world’s most famous masterpieces.

Team Play:
In team mode, this game can accommodate up to eight teams of six players. Each player will receive one painting card and the voting card will be switched between players on a team each turn. Players on the same team can work together to figure out who painted a teammate’s painting and to vote, however it is up to the player whose turn it is to make the final choice. In team mode, players cannot exchange their painting cards for another. The game will end after six paintings have been placed next to an artist from each team.

boardgame.name: The Jackbox Party Pack 7
boardgame.description:
Five new games: the hit threequel Quiplash 3, the collaborative chaos of The Devils and the Details, the fierce drawing game Champ’d Up, the speech game Talking Points and the guessing game Blather Round. Use phones or tablets as controllers. Play with up to 8 players, and an audience of 10,000!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Business As Usual
boardgame.description:
The Island has long been ruled by the sophisticated elites. Their corruption has weakened the resolve of its inhabitants. For too long the corruption, greed and unethical ways of a few have been the detriment of the masses. Today marks a day of change: the day you take back the Island for the people!

Use your business savvy to beat your opponents and gain the respect of the Island!


Create wealth by building your businesses from the ground up
Upgrade businesses to squeeze every penny out of them
Purchase influence to tilt the scales in your favour
Out bid your opponents to put the rule bending lobbyists in your pocket for later
Vote (and rig) elections to make sure the economy runs to your liking
Complete Objectives to gain more respect than your opponents


On this island, respect rules all!

Business as Usual is a 75 minute, 3-4 players game strategic Eurogame that incorporates aspects of trading, bidding, voting for policy change, and cutting deals to benefit your businesses. There are multiple routes to success, allowing everyone to be on the edge of their seat right to the end.

Are you up for the challenge?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Model Builder
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Model Builder brings the joy of, well… model building, to the virtual world. It allows you to build model machines just like you would in reality, by cutting out, assembling, and then painting and customizing your creations. Fill your shelves with cars, planes, helicopters and tanks from various countries and eras, display them in dioramas to add a bit of shine and tell your own story. Sell your creations for-profit and expand your toolkit or simply let the works you're proud to be displayed on your Shelf of Glory.The game offers a wide variety of tools and models to choose from, as well as tons of paint colours and decals, that will make the assembled models truly your own. You are bound to have weeks upon weeks of creative fun - and meanwhile, your relatives won’t be able to complain that you fill every bit of free space with plastic toys that smell of glue and paint. Building models in virtual space has never been so fun!

Not everyone gets to be an engineer… but everyone can build impressive machines! Get the model you always wanted to build, cut it out, glue the pieces (be careful not to use too much glue though!) and polish the model to perfection.

Is assembly done? Does your model look solid? Time to make it look amazing. Up until this point, you followed a plan. Now it's time to unleash your creativity and make your creation look the way you wish it to. Add paint jobs and small details that will make the model your own. There's a ton of customization options for you to use and discover - making them work is up to you. Your creativity is the limit.

You might be already proud of your work, but there is still something to be done: create a story. Arrange your model (or models!) in a diorama, to make it look threatening, powerful, or simply impressive - it's your call.

You have a variety of tools at your disposal - everything you need to assemble your models and make them shine. If you need more specialized tools, there is some stuff to unlock too - as your workshop fills with mighty machines, you will also get new toys to help with precision work and finishes. You will feel like a pro in no time.

There's plenty to choose from in terms of what you can assemble… and once you are done, there's a ton more to unlock. Expect dozens of hours of fun and much more in post-release updates.

Source: The Game Website/ Press Kit.

boardgame.name: TFF: The Final Frontier
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Travel through the vast cosmic space, choose your battles wisely and outsmart your opponents. Experience spaceships battles like never before in this rogue-lite tactic game, based on unique physics system. Remember: death is not the end… but how much are you willing to sacrifice in the name of freedom?Became a rebel captain and fight against the Empire in this challenging tactic rogue-lite game. Travel through the galaxy, engage in spaceship battles and use the tactical advantages offered by the unique physics system. Decide about life or death of your crew and find out the price of freedom.

Travel through the vast, procedurally generated cosmic space in your struggle for freedom. Choose your battles wisely, because every encounter could become fatal. Death may not be the end, but it has mortifying consequences… So learn to take advantage of your surroundings, but be careful! The power of gravity can give you the much-needed speed-boost or toss you right at the enemy’s cannons; the meteor-shower may as easily become a safe refuge as a deadly trap. Remember, that there is no shame in retreat if it lets you survive…

Form a tactical formation to flawlessly execute your strategic plans. At your disposals, there are several motherships and support units belonging to four unique factions – each with different favored technologies and ship characteristics. At any times you may count on a few tricks hidden up your sleeve, but don’t forget about one rule: never depend on a single solution. The key to survival in the galaxy is flexibility and adapting to rapidly changing conditions.

With the forces of the Empire on your tail, you can’t always count on help from other rebels. Manage your limited resources wisely or die in the cold space. In the heat of the battle, even the lives of your crew members have a certain value… But how much are you willing to sacrifice in the name of freedom?

Sink into the fascinating story of the Holy Human Empire, ruled by one Emperor in the name of the ruthless god. Although the grip of his oppression on humanity is tightening, there are still varying cultures among the distant stars. The United Kingdom of Atum trusts in its science and cutting-edge technologies, The Children of Endless maintain their union with nature, while Intergalactic Trade Consortium counts spoils and riches. All of them may support your righteous cause… or turn their backs on the Rebellion.

Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: 5 Room Dungeons Zine #2: The Shattered Heroes of Myste Cryk
The Shattered Heroes of Myste Cryk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A party of successful NPC adventurers have returned to their home village of Myste Cryk to retire in peace.

Unfortunately, a villain they recently crossed marches towards Myste Cryk with a legion of undead, bent on the destruction of everything the heroes love.

Even worse, the NPCs hate each other.

A major falling out means there's no organized effort to defend the villagers from what now looks like certain doom.

Can the player characters bring the Heroes of Myste Cryk back together again in time to save the villagers from a terrible demise?

boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Ignis: Duels of Wizards is a fast-paced battle arena about duels between powerful wizards. The core element of the game is the unique fighting mechanics that allow players to customize path of every magical projectile. That way they can omit obstacles, slip past enemies defenses, collect powerups or gain tactical advantage by interacting with the environment. Besides basic projectiles, each character has access to a vast arsenal of magical weaponry – meteors falling from the sky, summonable minions, curses and ultimate attacks.Players can choose between powerful playable wizards, each of them uses a different style of magic – like elemental powers, alchemy or shamanic voodoo. Every hero has a unique, “theme” based set of attacks, spells and passive, that can be dynamically upgraded between rounds of the duels. It enables developing an individual strategy when fighting different opponents.

The singleplayer mode will include a full campaign, revealing the backstory of each character as well as the lore of the whole in-game universe. The campaign mode resembles popular titles form fighting games genre. Set of duels will allow players to experience fighting with all the playable wizards, learn their strengths and weaknesses. There will also be separate singleplayer modes with features altering the flow of the game.

Ignis truly shines in multiplayer mode – both local or online. The split-screen mode allows players to either fight against each other on different arenas with adjustable properties or join forces against constantly learning AI. Online multiplayer takes the challenge up to ranked duels in which players can compete with people all over the world.

Source: The Game Press Kit.
boardgame.videogameversion: Live Xbox Series X downloadable edition

boardgame.name: Door Kickers 2: Task Force North
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Command military Special Ops Teams in gripping tactical combat against a Middle East-based terrorist network.The long awaited sequel to the hit tactics game Door Kickers, Task Force North brings you the best portrayal of modern Close Quarters Combat and Tactics in a video game. It is OUT NOW in Early Access.

Door Kickers 2 is a top down strategy and tactics game about using intelligence assets and controlling Special Operation Units in daring raids to neutralize and capture terrorists in the fictional country of Nowheraki, Middle East.

True to the violent and dynamic nature of combat in the region, the game models deadly threats and technologies such as booby traps, suicide bombers, RPGs and concealed insurgents – while handing you new toys such as Light Machine Guns for suppressive fire, drone reconnaissance, night vision goggles and wall breaching charges.

Adding further to the roster of improvements, you can now choose the unit to deploy for any mission. The United States Army Rangers make for the initial deployment option, but soon we will reveal other – distinct but equally cool units. The choice will not be simply one of skins and weapons, but also come with distinct playing style and abilities we will reveal further down development road.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: BioShock 4
Bioshock Isolation
Parkside
boardgame.description: Several members that were part of the original BioShock game are part of the studio, including Hoagy de la Plante, Scott Sinclair, and Jonathan Pelling.

boardgame.name: Dune Sea
boardgame.description:
Dune Sea a side-scrolling platform adventure game that lets you fly like a bird. Soar the skies and survive the elements as you traverse beautifully crafted landscapes.

In Dune Sea you will guide a migrating bird that got separated from its flock due to a catastrophic event, which somehow transformed a fertile area into a hostile and desolate wasteland. In order to survive you would need to fly across beautiful landscapes of strange and foreign land, while collecting items and avoiding predators.

Features


Learn to Fly
The game is populated with multiple types of birds, all featuring rich and detailed animations. You will quickly spread your wings and take off into the skies, where you fly in different speeds, flap, make turns, and smoothly glide. Soon you will gain the ability to perform exciting aerial stunts - and use them to escape danger.
Build your flock
As you progress you encounter other flocking birds that you can invite to fly together with you. With a sophisticated flocking mechanism, you will be able lead a flock of your own!
Chill and Explore a Low Poly world
The world of Dune Sea has a varied and diverse environments: dunes, rocky deserts, salt flats, volcanos and strange forests, all crafted with a minimalist low polygon art.
Rich detailed animations of Birds


Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: Super Bomberman R Online
boardgame.description:
Super Bomberman R Online (スーパーボンバーマン R オンライン Sūpā Bonbāman R Onrain) is a battle royale game developed and published by Konami and released for Google Stadia on September 1, 2020. It is a spin-off of the Bomberman series.
Like Super Bomberman R, the game contains various characters from Konami's famous franchises.



Description


Blast your way to the top!


With the new Battle 64 mode, players will automatically be placed in one of many areas at the start of each match, and must battle it out against other players in the same area. Areas will begin to close down as the clock ticks and players must pass through the gates to the other remaining areas before the timer runs out!


Take advantage of Crowd Play!


Play with your favorite streamer by joining their game through the Crowd Play feature! Seamlessly join the streamer's game by accessing the link on the screen.


Customize your character and win with style!


Dress up your Bomberman! Equip a bomb of your choice! Pick your favorite outfit and head into battle! Each customizable bomb skin comes with their own unique blast!

Source: Bomberman Wiki.

boardgame.name: Przebudzenie Bogów
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's page:

Chcesz wiedzieć jak zmieniłby się świat gdyby naglę powrócili dawni bogowie? Masz dość wszechobecnej mitologii Greków i Rzymian? Dla odmiany chciałbyś przenieść się w krainę pełną bóstw, bestii i demonów z wierzeń słowiańskich, skandynawski i hinduskich? Zastanawiasz się czy odnaleźli by się w Naszym świecie? Albo czy My bylibyśmy w stanie współistnieć z Nimi? Jeśli ciekawi Cię to, to ten podręcznik może być dla Ciebie!

Przebudzenie Bogów to gra fabularna w klimacie urban fantasy. Tworzy go grupa, która swój brak doświadczenia w dziedzinie nadrabia zapałem i kreatywnością.

W podręczniku znajdziesz m.in. szczegółowy opis świata przedstawionego, 13 ras od których może pochodzić Twoja postać, 10 bóstw z panteonów: słowiańskiego, nordyckiego oraz hinduskiego, 20 profesji wraz z opisami zdolności specjalnych dla każdej z nich, dokładny opis mechaniki gry oraz bestiariusz, zielnik, postacie niezależne, a także kilka przykładowych przygód. Wszystko w komplecie z unikalną szatą graficzną.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fundacja Rozwoju Ziemi Chojnickiej i Człuchowskiej

boardgame.name: Ovation
boardgame.description:
Become one of the greatest classical composers of all time! You'll use inspiration, seek fortune and hobnob with aristocrats to perform musical masterpieces and achieve your legacy in this engine building game for 1-5 players. Get inspired by your rivals' performances to create your own works of genius as the game builds to a crescendo.

Each turn, players choose one of four actions: Seek Inspiration, Seek Fortune, Seek Patronage, or Perform. Inspiration is your primary resource and it comes in three tones - Joy, Passion and Sorrow. Seeking inspiration allows you to gain your resource while all of the other actions will have players spend inspiration to acquire cards. Fortune cards help build your engine, which can allow you to gain bonus actions on your turn. Patron cards can also help build your engine or can give you bonus legacy points for end game scoring. Chamber Music and Concert Music cards give you lots of legacy points, but every time you perform, your opponents can attend your performance and gain inspiration. You will not only have a special ability as your specific composer, but you are also the only person who can compose your very own Magnum Opus. Complete specific goals to gain Maestro cards and end the game.

Compose your masterpiece. Secure your legacy.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Loonacy Marvel
boardgame.description:
Loonacy Marvel is a rapid fire game where players race to be the first to empty their hand of 7 cards by matching one of two Marvel characters with the characters on the open piles in front of them. Speed of the hand and luck of the draw determine the winner in this frenzied free-for-all!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Loonacy Marvel — быстрая зажигательная игра, участники которой наперегонки избавляются от своих карт. Вы можете скинуть карту, если одна из двух её картинок совпадает с картинкой на карте, лежащей на столе. В этой карточной куче-мале героев вселенной Marvel побеждает самый быстрый и удачливый игрок!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Jocul Autostrazilor
boardgame.description:
A Romanian strategy game for 2-6 players. You need to build as many highways as you can but be careful! Your opponents will sabotage you with unexpected incidents: a broken viaduct, an appeal to the public auction, blocking the works and see if you can repel the attack of opponents with negotiations, allocation of funds, any new builder or with some electoral promises.
It is recommended for 14+ years old players.

How to play:

Cards with cities will be shuffled and equally distributed for all players. If any cards remain undistributed, you need to put them in a separate stack on the table.
Cards with vignette will be stacked on the table.
Cards with sabotage actions will be shuffled and given 10 to every player (if there are 6 players, any of them will be given 8 cards). The rest are placed on the table.


All players start from Bucharest and roll the dice. They need to move their pawn an equal number of points as corresponding on the dice (but he can't step twice on the same point in a turn). If the pawn is placed on a highway point, the player can ask for the related card, by initiating an act of sabotage against the player who owns that card.

What is sabotage:
Sabotage cards have a number of points (e.g.: 1 / 2 / 8 / 0.1 or -3 / -5 etc). A player who wants a card for a highway, needs to put down a sabotage card of negative value (e.g.: -3). The opponent must repel the attack with 1 or more cards with positive value until their sum is greater than the opponent's card (-1 equals +1 or overcome with +2). In case of equality, challenged player can keep his card. Otherwise, if the challenged player overcomes the attack, he can choose a card with cities from the player who initiated the attack. If the challenged player is defeated, the player who initiated the attack receives his requested card.

Vignette cards:
Can be used only at border crossing points in order to obtain 3 sabotage cards OR to ask for any of highway city cards.
Every route has a specific number of points. The player with most points wins.

boardgame.name: The Necronomicon Gamebook: Carcosa
boardgame.description:
From the Publisher:

After the success of the 1st volume, Dagon, here is the second and last chapter of this saga: The Necronomicon Gamebook – Carcosa, wich will draw you into the grim fantasies of Ambrose Bierce, Robert W. Chambers and Howard P. Lovecraft. Armed with a die and a pencil, you will traverse haunted places and come up against dark ancestral forces. To try and ward them off, you will use the powerful artefacts and ancient spells of The Necronomicon – if you don’t lose your mind first…

Here is the list of the famous classic stories that have been adapted in this nightmarish gamebook:

Ambrose Bierce – An Inhabitant of Carcosa (1893)
Robert W. Chambers – The Repairer of Reputations, The Yellow Sign in The King in Yellow (1895)
Howard P. Lovecraft – Nyarlathotep (1920)
Howard P. Lovecraft – What the Moon Brings (1923)
Howard P. Lovecraft – The Whisperer in Darkness (1930)
Howard P. Lovecraft – The Haunter of the Dark (1935)

boardgame.name: Die Händler vom Taubertal
boardgame.description: The Taubertal is in turmoil! From Bronnbach to Mergentheim the Black Knight is up to mischief. The merchants suffer most from the possible shape, because on his raids they are his enemy target. The traders from the Middle Taubertal allied themselves resolutely to a counterattack. Together they want to drive the Black Knight out and razor his castle to the ground. This will require some cannonballs - and these are costly. The race for the "bombing business" begins!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Fishkeeper
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Become a professional aquarist! Look after your aquarium by giving fish and other animals food, good conditions and nice company. Multiply and sell the best specimens at auctions. Take care of the fish, and they will repay you with a beautiful appearance that you can admire while cruising in a bathyscaphe!Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: 20 Dreams
boardgame.description:
20 Dreams is a storytelling card game where each player has a set of 20 emotion cards differentiated by colour. There is another set of white emotion cards in the centre along with picture prompt cards.
On a player’s turn, they take one emotion card and three picture cards from the centre. They then have to tell a story that uses the picture cards to express the emotion on the white emotion card, which is to be hidden from the other players. The game is themed as if you are telling the group about a dream you had, so the picture cards contain many common dream themes like flying and teeth.
Once the player has told their story involving the 3 picture cards the other players have to guess what emotion was being expressed using their own emotion cards. Those who are incorrect have their corresponding emotion cards taken away (placed in the penalty box), and those that were correct give their cards to the storyteller, the person with the most cards at the end is the winner.

—description from the publisher
