boardgame.name: Fragile
boardgame.description:
Game on human trafficking from a 10-year olds perspective.

User Summary

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Skaven
boardgame.description:
Cunning and malevolent, the skaven seek to spread ruin and corruption wherever they go. This insidious race of vermin-men worships the foul god known as the Great Horned Rat, and their plots and schemes are truly diabolical in their complexity.

Kill-steal in Warcry yes-yes! Ahem. If you’re looking to start a Skaven warband for skirmish battles (or expand one!), this set is for you, giving you everything you need for a diverse warband of ratmen. It also contains a number of accessories to help you in your games. What’s more, you’ll save money compared to getting the models inside separately!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Core Book

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Ironjawz
boardgame.description:
The Ironjawz are the biggest and hardest orruks of all. Clad in thick pig-iron armour and swinging enormous, bone breaking weapons, they live for nothing more than the chance to wreak untold devastation across the realms.

If you’re looking to dominate the Eightpoints for Gorkamorka (or just for a good laugh), then this is the Warcry set for you! Designed to make kicking off or expanding a diverse warband of Ironjawz simple, it also contains a number of accessories to help you in your games. What’s more, you’ll save money compared to getting the models inside separately!

–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Core Book
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Ironjawz

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse – Datasheet Cards: T'au Empire
boardgame.description:
A set of Datasheets specifically designed for using your T’au Empire Citadel miniatures in games of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse. Each datacard provides the full rules and profiles for a single unit from the T’au Empire faction. Also included is a Faction card that details the faction rules that apply to T’au Empire Detachments. The reverse side of each card features the faction’s icon.

The set includes datacards for the following units:


Commander Shadowsun
Commander Farsight
Commander
Aun’Va Aun’Shi
Ethereal
Cadre Fireblade
Darkstrider
Longstrike
Breacher Team
Strike Team
Kroot Carnivores
Kroot Shaper
Krootox Riders
XV25 Stealth Battlesuits
XV8 Crisis Battlesuits
XV8 Crisis Bodyguards
Firesight Marksman
XV95 Ghostkeel Battlesuit
XV104 Riptide Battlesuit
Pathfinder Team
TX4 Piranhas
Tactical Drones
Vespid Stingwings
Kroot Hounds
XV88 Broadside Battlesuits
TX7 Hammerhead Gunship
TX78 Sky Ray Gunship
MV71 Sniper Drones
TY7 Devilfish
AX3 Razorshark Strike Fighter
AX39 Sun Shark Bomber
Tidewall Shieldline
Tidewall Droneport
Tidewall Gunrig
KV128 Stormsurge


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ugly Gryphon Inn: Local Dragons
boardgame.description:
You’ve handled plenty of rowdy customers in your time, from monks and mages to giants and goblins, but there’s one thing you’ve never faced: the mighty Dragon. Now your humble inn has drawn the attention of an ancient wyrm. Pay close attention to who leaves and who stays: if your departing Patrons irritate the lurking Dragon, all your hard work is sure to go up in flames!

Each game using the Local Dragons expansion adds 1 of 3 possible Dragons to your Inn. As Patrons leave, check their symbols to see whether they provoke the Dragon. If the Dragon is sufficiently provoked -- two matching symbols accumulated -- you’ll lose the game.

listing.notes: Ended up with an extra copy of Local Dragons expansion.

boardgame.name: Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm Abridged (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm is the largest, most comprehensive, most flexible, and most ambitious fantasy roleplaying bestiary ever conceived. 6,400 complete statblocks, comprising 1,600 monsters, each given the Quadded Statblock treatment, enabling them to be used in any campaign setting, with PCs of any level.

Add to this a thoroughly innovative and massively expandable AI system to guide monster behavior, and you have what just might be the most impressive and valuable creature resource ever to hit Pathfinder, 5E, Pathfinder Second Edition, OSR, and DCC.

boardgame.name: Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm Abridged (DCC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm is the largest, most comprehensive, most flexible, and most ambitious fantasy roleplaying bestiary ever conceived. 6,400 complete statblocks, comprising 1,600 monsters, each given the Quadded Statblock treatment, enabling them to be used in any campaign setting, with PCs of any level.

Add to this a thoroughly innovative and massively expandable AI system to guide monster behavior, and you have what just might be the most impressive and valuable creature resource ever to hit Pathfinder, 5E, Pathfinder Second Edition, OSR, and DCC.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: The Caves of Ikthis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

No one wanted to stop in Birkport. It had an odd reputation even before the disappearances started. The mage was worried about his relatives, though, and it turned out he was right to be afraid. The streets are full of strange fish-people and residents are murmuring about ominous things taking place in the caves...

This is a system-agnostic dungeon designed to slot easily into whatever kind of campaign you might be running. Use it as a fishing village, a random wilderness encounter, or the location of important information/items the party needs.

boardgame.name: The Synth Divergence
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the wake of the rising cost of air travel and development of clean propulsion methods the city of Liverpool has returned to its roots as a hub of ocean shipping. Thousands of workers have flocked to the docks in search of employment, managing a never ending stream of bulk cargo.

Then came Synthetics, true artificial consciousness with the potential to upend the economy. As their numbers increase so does their dominance in the workplace and the careful balance between workers and the Corporations hangs by a thread.

boardgame.name: The Curse of Ipaúna
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The archives of the Society of Jesus contain a mysterious letter, which tells of a group of some fifty Frenchmen who entered the salt marsh beyond Uruçumirim and were never seen again.

The letter also speaks of a ‘great treasure’ brought by Captain Remy LaSalle, leader of the expedition. In the years since, no banner company has found this supposed treasure. And now a group of young adventurers has gone missing while searching for it.

Will your group succeed in tracking them down and bringing them home safely?
Or will they simply become the latest victims of the Curse of Ipaúna?

Number of participants: One mediator and 3 to 6 players. The ideal number is five participants in total.

Time: 3 to 6 hours, depending on the players’ choices.

Recommendations: The Curse of Ipaúna is ideal as an introductory adventure for a new
group of characters and is easy to use in an existing campaign. It’s particularly useful if you want to introduce new characters to an ongoing story: simply have the new characters also apply for the job of finding the missing boy.

The group should have between them at least level 1 in Tracking, Land Navigation, Canoeing and Foraging. Combat skills will be important, although not all the challenges of the adventure can be overcome through force. Diplomacy and negotiation skills will be of paramount importance in completing the mission.

boardgame.name: Space Noble
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alien kings, space monarchs, rulers of the known universe, decadent nobles of a highly advanced and technological civilization, and of course Space Princesses are staples of space operas, sci-fi sagas, and tales of strange worlds and other dimensions. The Warriors of the Red Planet roleplaying game provides the basics needed to run a Sword & Planet style interplanetary fantasy romance campaign using the classic OSR style rules. However if there was one class that was missing it was the Space Noble -- the aristocracy of the dying red planet. This supplement endeavors to fill that gap with a very playable royal character class, though its primary purpose is to describe the NPC’s that the player characters will encounter.

The Space Noble is designed to work with any science fiction or science fantasy OSR style RPG that is based on the original fantasy roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Super Adventure Plug-in: More to Fear
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Feasters-on-Fear can hear your heavy breathing, be still the beating of your heart for it calls to them! The time has come to add a dash of horror to your games for the 3rd edition of the world’s most popular OGL superhero RPG.

What is a Plug-In?

This product is a part of a supplement line to support expanded adventures for the 3rd edition of the world’s most popular OGL superhero RPG. Each Super-Powered Adventure Plug-In is a third-party supplement designed to fit directly into the themes and narrative of an existing super heroic adventure, allowing you – the Game Master – to extend the story to dizzying new heights. Each Plug-In is designed in a manner that uses the existing rules you are familiar with, bringing forward a creative new look at an existing scenario.

Though each Super-Powered Adventure Plug-In all shares a theme with a specific escapade, they are designed to be easily incorporated into your home game regardless of what scenarios or style campaign you may be running. Each continues a rich narrative background and series of thematically evocative rules to help the Game Master craft fantastic adventures and dire challenges for their players.

boardgame.name: Habroxia
boardgame.description:
Save the galaxy in this classic shoot'em up game!

Blast your way through a myriad of extra terrestrial incursions in this arcade-style scrolling shooter! Pilot the ship Habroxia through 15 levels featuring intense boss fights, rescue missions, shifting perspectives and untold surprises. Customize your ship to enhance your abilities, unlock the three endless side modes, and save the galaxy from a series of sinister invaders.

Features:
15 campaign levels
3 distinct firing patterns
Persistent ship upgrade system
Over 10 unique boss fights
Over 50 different enemy types with multiple iterations
Horizontal and vertical levels
3 endless side modes featuring distinct gameplay
New & exclusive boss rush mode

(from microsoft.com website)

boardgame.name: Gordian Quest
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





An epic roguelike that combines the best elements of deckbuilding, tactical combat and strategic decision-making. Lead and manage heroes on gruelling missions. Forge bonds and discover new skills among them. Unravel curses laid upon the lands and defeat the ultimate evil at the heart of it all.Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Les Gens Qui
boardgame.description:
Les Gens Qui is THE party game to judge all the people who annoy us every day. It's a simple, fast and interactive card game.

The aim of the game? Try to guess what your friends think of these people.

Each player chooses a set of hand cards which will allow them to choose from 4 different sanctions: Heart On You, Just a Finger , One Year of Gulag or Death Sentence.

One the players is the judge. He takes 3 situation cards, reads them at loud and puts them face up in the middle of the board.

For example :

People who sniff instead of blowing their nose,
People who say "I'm not a racist, but...",
People who are ALWAYS late.


The judge gives his opinion by placing cards face down on the board. The other players do the same and vote, face down, trying to guess what the Judge has voted. The player who have the most answers in common with the Judge score 1 point for each correct answer!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Les Gens Qui Trash
boardgame.description:
This game is an expansion pack for the “Les Gens Qui” board game. You will be able to judge even more trashy situations and try to guess what your friends think.

In Les Gens Qui - Trash expansion, you can find :


330 new people cards to judge.
1 new exclusive hand set to mix with the basic version hand sets for playing up to 9 players.
1 alternative game rule to discover a new game mode!


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Thesë Go to Eleven
boardgame.description:
A game of pushing your limits, and then some.


Inspired on the cult film This Is Spinal Tap.

Front is pure black. Tribute to fictional Spinal Tap's Black Album, who, in the classic 1984 movie This Is Spinal Tap, were forced to put out their album "Smell the Glove" with an all-black cover after their label refused to release the original, sexually offensive artwork.


Released in the November 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


GOAL
Be the first player to make the numbers 1 through 11 in order using die rolls and card play.

SETUP
Sort the cards by suit, then give each player A-2-3-4-5-6-7 cards of a suit. This is their Hand. The other cards aren't used.

GAMEPLAY
On your turn, choose to roll one or two dice. You will then use the sum of one or more cards to make one addition or subtraction by combining the sum of the card(s) from your hand with the die roll.

If the exact target number is rolled
You may choose to either:

Stop rolling and draw one card from the center pool.
Discard cards to the table face up to combine with your die roll to equal the desired number.


If the target number is not rolled
You must either:

discard cards to the table face up to make your die roll equal the desired number.
Choose to end your turn.


After a number is made (via the combination of dice and cards) you will choose to either:

Continue to the next consecutive number.
Pass your turn, and draw two cards from the center pool.


If a number cannot be made, you bust. Your turn ends and you draw no cards.

On every subsequent turn, you will begin by choosing 1 card from the common pool and achieve the same target number you failed at your last turn.

END OF GAME
When a player reaches 11, the game will end once all players have taken their turn. The first player to get a value of 11 is the winner, and if tied, the player with the largest sum of values in their hand wins the game.

boardgame.name: Hellish Quart
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Hellish Quart is a fighting game about sword one-on-one dueling, in which the blades block each other using physics, and the characters use motion captured fencing techniques. Players will be able to fight as one of many 17th century warriors: Cossacks, Hussars, Janissaries, Highlanders, Tatars and will use sabers, rapiers, broadswords, longswords and many other blades. The game is is a love letter to ever more popular Historical European Martial Arts (also known as HEMA).Hellish Quart is an indie game created by a team of just two developers and will be released on Steam Early Access and will include single player and local multiplayer mode, but you will still be able to play online, using Steam Remote Play Together (https://store.steampowered.com/remoteplay).

Hellish Quart is a spiritual successor to games like Bushido Blade or Kengo, but with European twist. Main feature of the game is that the swords actually physically clash and block each other, using game engine’s physics simulation. There are no visible health bars and, like in formentioned games, fighters can be killed by a single, well timed and measured attack.

The controls

The view and controls are very similar to a regular 3D fighting game. Players walk with the gamepad’s left stick or a d-pad and the four gamepad buttons represent 4 attack angles. Different button combinations give special attacks and combos. If you are not attacking, your character will automatically try to hold guard against your opponent's attacks. “Try”, because the characters, when blocking, are not invulnerable, like in other games. The only thing that is stopping the opponent’s blade to cut into them, is their own, physical blade, that’s in the way.

The looks

Gameplay looks and feels like a real HEMA duel, you can see on YouTube. There are no hollywood-style, flashy, but unrealistic moves. This is because all animations in the game are recorded by HEMA practitioners, using motion capture. Jakub Kisiel, the head developer of the game, is a mocap artist that formerly worked on games like Bulletstorm and The Witcher III and a lifetime sword fighting enthusiast.

The Setting

Hellish Quart happens in a historical, realistic setting. The game takes place in 17th century Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth. This place and time is a wonderful mix of cultures and races, constant wars, battles and duels. It is also a period in which the swords reached their peak in variety and specialisation. All this allows for a really varied character roster. You will duel Zaporozhian Cossacks, Polish Hussars, Tatars, Turkish Janissaries, Swedish Reiters, French Musketeers and more. You will use sabers, palaches, basket hilt swords, rapiers and even an ancient german longsword.

The graphics

The character models are made from 3D scanned, real, historical reconstruction clothes. To do that, the developers use photogrammetry - it’s a scanning technique, where multiple photos of a piece of wardrobe are taken from every possible angle. Then, the scanning software can reconstruct the scanned piece in 3D space.
Features


Sword fighting using active ragdolls and physical sword collisions
Super-realistic motion captured fencing animations
3D scanned 17th century characters


Planned game modes:


arcade
single player story (with 3d cutscenes!)
local Versus mode (Steam Play Together supported at EA launch)
training / sparring


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: You're Tearing Me Apart
boardgame.description:
A legacy game where you throw cards, not footballs.

Inspired on the cult film The Room.


Released in the September 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


INITIAL SETUP
Separate the deck into red/black cards & remove the jokers; give one set to each player. Each player shuffles their deck and draws 5 cards.

GOAL
Earn the most points. Points accrue over games with the same deck.

TURN
You must choose one action:

Draw: Draw from 1-5 cards from your deck, then discard that many cards. Discarded cards will not be available to you again this game.
Play: Play one card from your hand to your tableau, then draw one card from your deck.
Tear: Tear apart one card from a set in your tableau and throw half of it at your opponent's tableau.
Replace: Replace a card matching the number of one of your previously destroyed cards with half of your destroyed card from your reserve, then throw that half at your opponent's tableau. Shuffle the whole card back into your deck, then draw one card.
Score: Tear apart one card from a set, discard the rest of that set from your tableau, then add that set's value to your score (points according to a table). Add both halves to your reserve (instead of throwing that torn card).


TEARING APART & THROWING
You may tear apart any card in a set from your tableau to throw half at your opponent's tableau. If it touches any of your opponent's cards, you may choose one and any in its set to discard from the game. You earn half the points that your opponent would have earned from scoring that set. You determine which cards are in that set.

Once you have thrown half of a card, you cannot throw it again during that game.

SETS
A set is a grouping of paired and sequential cards played to the tableau. It must meet all of the following three conditions:
1) To start a set, there must be a matching pair of numbers.
2) A set can be extended +1/-1 from any pair in the set. Aces wrap.
3) Sets must be touching each other in the tableau.

END OF GAME
When a player needs to draw but cannot, their opponent gets one final turn and the game ends.

SETUP FOR SUBSEQUENT GAMES
All torn cards are placed in your reserve at the start of the game.The starting player is the player with the current lower score.

END OF ALL GAMES
When the game ends without either player scoring any points, the game is all torn apart. The player with the highest total score wins.

boardgame.name: Honey, I Joined a Cult
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Honey, I Joined a Cult puts you in control of your own 1970s cult. Build and expand your base, manage your resources and make as much money out of your followers as possible.BASE BUILDING!
Set up your cult HQ. Cultists don’t want much but they’ll definitely need to use a toilet at some stage, and beds mean they can indoctrinate with a decent night’s sleep. The Hypno-Chamber will remind followers of what’s really important and the Pool of Revelations will reveal their hidden traits – maybe they’re a genius, maybe they spend an especially long time on the toilet.

HIT THE BIG TIME!
If you’re going to progress you’re going to need some wealthy and influential members, preying on the destitute just doesn’t pay the bills. Not everyone wants your cult to succeed though; the Government, journalists and cultists’ family members all seem to hate you?! And that’s to say nothing of the local rival cult.
Watch out for your leader too – his ego will get out of check. Looks like you’ll be building a statue to his awesomeness after all.

Whatever happens, keep making money as you slowly realise the Grand Plan.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: A Man on the Road
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A rider looms on the road ahead. His tattered clothes and ravaged face competes for grotesquery with his mangy, tick-riddled horse. His hefty baggage bulges temptingly. Would you dare rob a man on the road?

This pamphlet adventure for Old-School Essentials answers the question: What if an apparently typical random encounter held far more in store than the party would ever dream of bargaining for. Contained here is a single, devilishly difficult to kill NPC with endless tricks up his sleeves, including:

False identities to lure the party into careless complacency.
Fighting styles and underhanded tactics to thwart any plan and keep the party on their toes.
Foul vulgarities unleashed by his fetid tongue, such as: Pestilent corpse fit only to satisfy a blind mule and blaspheming devil-humper.
Worthy and strange loot to reward the victorious.

boardgame.name: Time Machine Rocket
boardgame.description:
Time Machine Rocket is a fast, simple and fun card game. It has a great balance between strategy and luck, in addition to the possibility of interfering in the opponents' game.

The theme is inspired by time travel narratives that promote the unexpected encounter of figures from different eras. In short, the idea is to travel in time in search of forming the best team of historical personalities, bringing together figures such as Leonardo da Vinci and Bruce Lee.

In each turn, the player opens a card from the historic decks. She then decides whether to bring that character to her team, or to open a new card. If she opens a Rocket, she advances to the next deck. If she opens a character of the same type that she opened before, she now have to put that character on her team.

The game ends when a player forms a team of 5 characters, of 5 different types (Humanitarian, Military, Creative, Scientist and Explorer). The player sums up the numbers of each character, and the one with most points wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Voyages of Marco Polo: Folded Space Insert (Second edition)
boardgame.description:
Insert compatible with The Voyages of Marco Polo including the The New Characters mini expansion and The Agents of Venice expansion. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 31.8 x 22.9 x 7.1 cm. Note also that this is the revised version of our original FS-MPO insert.

Insert is separately compatible with Marco Polo II: In the Service of the Khan.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Marco Polo II: In the Service of the Khan
The Voyages of Marco Polo: Agents of Venice
The Voyages of Marco Polo: The New Characters

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Crusade Mission Pack – Beyond the Veil
boardgame.description:
This mission pack is a narrative play expansion for the Warhammer 40,000 Crusade campaign system.

Within, you’ll find the rules required to play games of Warhammer 40,000 set in the mysterious region of space known as the Pariah Nexus. This mission pack has been specifically designed for use in narrative play Crusade games, where your armies will find themselves beset by the unsettling effects that earned the Pariah Nexus its ominous name. But whilst there is great danger to be found here, for those who are successful, the rewards are well worth the risk.

Inside this 112-page mission pack you will find:

- Six new missions each for Combat Patrol, Incursion, Strike Force and Onslaught sized games
- A selection of new Battle Traits and Crusade Relics
- A swathe of gaming material, including a new Theatre of War and a glossary

The pack itself is presented in a full Canadian wiro ring-bound book for easy use and reference on the tabletop during games, and comes with an elastic closure.

boardgame.name: The Great Trial: Christmas
boardgame.description:
"The Great Trial: Christmas is a one-page adventure for 4 2nd-level characters. It consists of a short hexcrawl designed specifically to challenge novice adventures. It's focused on all pillars of D&D."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Manchester by Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Revolutions and Violence, Scuttlers and Scientists, Cotton and Conspiracy

This is Manchester

It’s the year 1880, and in barely a century Manchester has gone from being a small market town to the world’s first and foremost industrial metropolis, where millions toil in the rain and smoke, gangs fight in the slums and pubs, fortunes are made and lost at the Exchange, and the world is changed forever.

Vampire: The Victorian Age, Manchester by Night includes:

A History of Manchester from small Roman Outpost to Cottonopolis, the Birthplace of the Industrial Revolution
The Culture, People, and Landscape of Manchester and Surrounds in Victorian Times
Over 25 Characters, including the Notable Kindred and Kine of the Region
Story Ideas and Conspiracies to add the cogs and wheels of Industrial Manchester to your Vampire: The Victorian Age Chronicle.
A New Thaumaturgical Path: Machine Mastery

boardgame.name: The Broken-Brother
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Start Your Savage Age Chronicle Here.

Weaponized Ink is offering prospective players and long-time fans of Werewolf the Savage Age a low-cost way to start playing! This Epic* Jump Start is an easy way to start your exploration into Werewolf: the Apocalypse's War of Rage and the Stone Age.
Our Job is to Make Your Job Easier.
Inside You Will Find:

- An adventure that explores the repercussions of the War of Rage.

- An easy and cost-effective way to start playing in the Savage Age line. This Jump Start is made for veterans of the War of Rage as well as new players. All are welcome. All will come to understand the Broken-Brother!

- More than ten pregenerated PCs and NPCs - including supporting characters designed to provide the foundation of a longer chronicle.

- MORE PAUL WAY ART! Just look at that cover! Buy this so we can commission more.

- The narrative foundation for some pretty exciting flashbacks and past-life options for your Werewolf: the Apocalypse games.

- Advice for playing in the Pleistocene - a time very alien from our own, where assumptions about the modern nights are turned on their head.

- A few little surprises at the end. It is worth reading all the way to the final pages.

This Epic Jumpstart was designed to be played with only the baseline Werewolf: the Apocalypse book -- but owning at least Accounting for the Dead (Savage Age Volume 1) is HIGHLY recommended. Ownership of The Rise of the Garou (Savage Age Volume 2) will be important if you want to play with the setting and characters beyond this introductory adventure.

boardgame.name: Werewolf the Savage Age Vol. 3: Tools of Extinction
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Epic Weapons and Tools That Defined the War of Rage!

The dawn of civilization was a period of unprecedented power for the spiritual weapons and tools of the Fera. 10,000 years ago fetishes, talens and totems looked and operated on a scale that modern Garou would look upon with awe. With this Savage Age book you have a toolbox of items and mechanics to make the Savage Age feel different than the modern Apocalypse.

Savage Age Volume 3 continues Volume 1 and Volume 2's exploration of the War of Rage.

In this book are the tools and mechanics to help you get into the mindset of a Pleistocene-era Fera. There are new stories, fetishes, mechanics, totems, and essays on how to play in a Savage Age game (and were designed to be useful in a Werewolf: the Apocalypse game as well)

Apocalypse or Savage Age -- Werewolf players will want this book.

The Tools of Extinction
The Savage Age Vol: 3 Features:

LOTS of new Paul Way art! Lots. This is an item book, and we made sure that the items inside are defined not only mechanically, but also in terms of images.
Designed for Werewolf: the Apocalypse and Werewolf: the Savage Age.
Character-focused rules and setting background for playing in the War of Rage.
Dozens of new fetishes and talens specifically designed to reflect the power, mystery and epicness of the Savage Age.


"Awakened Fetishes" - festishes with unlockable powers that grow with the spiritual power of their user.

New totems designed with period-specific mechanics. These are not throw-away totems - but redesigns of old favorites as well as new approaches to new concepts.
Essays designed to make approaching the Pleistocene less intimidating.
Writers' and editor's notes that discusses design decisions.

boardgame.name: Harvest Moon Style
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Harvest Moon Style is the art of fighting with every weapon on the battlefield. The harvest warrior is a swordsman who doesn't carry her own sword to a fight — someone else's will do just fine. It has a focus on the disarm gambit and dodges. It's very effective against small armies and people who got just a little too proud of their ancestral weapons. This style is a good choice for farmers, phantom thieves, and former bandits who are now temple guardians. (Guess what I've been reading lately.)

boardgame.name: Peacock Style
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Peacock Style is a flamboyant art featuring two-handed weapons, which is infamous across Creation as a style dedicated to intemperance, vanity, and worse. But isn't that the whole point? This mannerly but disreputable school is built on magnetism, deception, and innuendo, and is proud of it.

Adherents of Peacock Style dress in bright colors and ostentatious adornments in the very latest fashion. They wouldn’t dream of attending a duel, or even fighting in a bloody war, unless their clothing and cosmetics were unimpeachable. This is the heart of the style. When the Peacock warrior commands attention, he controls what his opponents perceive. They dodge in and out of the path of his spear, letting him set the pace, but are unable to predict the appearance of his dagger — even if they knew it was coming.

boardgame.name: Hedgehog Style
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hedgehog Style teaches that the best defense is a good offense. The hedgehog warrior turns her spear into a wall of spikes to ward away her enemies. If a spear isn't available, a knife will do, or a broken board, or a hairpin. Honestly, the broken board is convenient, because then when the battle is over you can toss it down and wander off to find a bowl of noodles while looking stupid and innocent.

boardgame.name: Night's Canopy Style
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Night's Canopy Style is a combat art using short swords, short spears, and the whip. Have you ever wanted to be a dinosaur matador? Well, here's your chance! Evade your opponents with grace while driving them into a rage. Skip nimbly across the battlefield while you bleed your enemies dry. Don't forget to start off the engagement with a thrown rose! (Elegance must come first.)

boardgame.name: Mouse Style
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nobody suspects the mouse, and that is what makes them deadly. Mouse Style is a combat art that focuses on disarming your enemies by acting harmless and playing the fool, encouraging them to focus on your tougher allies. Then, while the cat's away, you take the initiative and prepare to strike back.

This is the perfect style for the member of the group who isn't the Dawn, but wants to be in a position to support allies with a stronger combat investment. It also has a much higher density of references to other media than our previous styles, because it turns out there are a lot more famous mice than famous hedgehogs.

boardgame.name: Salamander Style
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Salamander Style is an art of fire, smoke, and illusion. Rather than traditional martial gear, the salamander warrior wears a cabbage-patch of clothing covered in gaudy ornaments. A stranger (being no fool) will correctly assume that these ornaments have some murderous purpose. They are tools of concealment and distraction, for casting light off a gold medallion or a blade into an opponent’s eyes, or creating patterns of light and dust that appear to be incoming attacks.

Many Salamander warriors supplement these tools with an interest in alchemy. If there’s no light, a few firecrackers thrown into the mix will keep things interesting. If there’s too much light, smoke bombs and even stranger things can be used to provide the concealment the style needs to function. The most advanced (or reckless) students of the style use jury-rigged firewands with ammunition they formulated themselves. It’s no wonder the school still has a reputation for surprises, although sometimes the surprise is that they haven’t blown themselves to bits.

boardgame.name: Rat Fist Style
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rat Fist Style is a disreputable bare-handed style coming out of the West and into back alleys everywhere. If you've ever wanted the chance to box your way through Creation, you now have it. Onslaught penalties! Terrible injuries leaving nothing but improbably-cool scars! Repeatedly punching people in the head until your words sound reasonable! These are the secret techniques of the disorderly masters of Rat Fist.

boardgame.name: Mountain Goat Style
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mountain Goat Style is a sling-using, kick-loving art from the high peaks, but which also translates well to city rooftops, fortress walls, and other high places. It's the art of controlling vertical space, keeping your opponents at a distance, and throwing giant rocks at their head. It contains only one reference to the band the Mountain Goats, which is me apologizing for not including more references to the band the Mountain Goats.

boardgame.name: The Missing Link
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Someone went missing, which started the chain of kidnappings. Now, someone of important to an old man had been kidnapped. The old man is desperate to find out where they were taken. It’s up to the adventurers to find out where the others were taken.

Part 1 of The Frozen Eye series.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Level 1-4 Characters. Optimized for APL 2.

boardgame.name: Orcus on 34th Level (PF)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

This high-level adventure plunges the players into the lowest depths of a mega-dungeon — the 34th level! This traditional dungeon crawl is anything but. Welcome to The Candy Crypt, where the foul demon, Orcus’s Claws, manufactures bittersweet treats and poisoned dreams. As the title suggests, this adventure can be placed at the bottom of any mega-dungeon, or it can be an isolated crypt hidden within the peaks of any frozen mountain chain.

Inventory your gear and pack well, you are going to need it.

The cold winds wash down from the north as the Northern Azure star shines over the village of Newville. The stars are right as the constellation Gorgon Major rises in the east for the first time in a millennium. Sages scream in terror as they realize that the time is nigh. Orcus’ Claws won’t be alone anymore; his beloved estranged wife, banished by the Forces of Law into a pocket dimension beyond the stars, is about to be released. It is the adventurers’ duty to thwart the summoning ritual — Claws must be stopped at all cost — he cannot summon his wife, Nohell Claws!

boardgame.name: The Second Grimoire of Pharesm the Bright-Eyed
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The rules contained in this booklet are major modifications to the current editions of the DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Basic Set, Expert Set, and Companion Set (the latter has just been published and is not much dealt with in these rules as that level of play (15th to 25th level) will probably never be reached) rules which are published by TSR. Possession and understanding of at least the D&D Basic Set Rules is required to understand and use the modifications presented herein.

User summary:

These house rules for "The Gamer's Lair D&D Campaign" provide an interesting glimpse into the once-very-common practice of playing "Variant D&D" (or "VD&D"), an early precursor to the more recent practice of retro-cloning.

boardgame.name: LOGOS
boardgame.description:
LOGOS is a RPG where players are Verbemages, magicians who use spoken words to modify reality, with an original system of magic based on playing cards.

The Verbemages evolve in the Magiverse, an multiverse where language is the “source code” and that contains an infinity of worlds. All universes (med-fan, sci-fi, horror, contemporary…) can be integrated into the Magiverse - in fact, one may be unaware of this, but they are already there! It is also possible to include LOGOS into many other RPGs by adding the story, secrets and factions presented in LOGOS, or just the magic system.

boardgame.name: Democracy: The Cards Game
boardgame.description:
In Democracy: The Cards Game, become the president of the Banana Island Republic, the country where defending the indefensible will lead you to be the president of a nation.

What does washing dishes with a loaf of bread have to do with promoting the country's industry? Get your rhetoric and creativity to make your speech the most voted to achieve your goal, become a president.

How to play:

In Democracy: The Cards Game the players have to argue in a 60 second speech using the cards they have chosen, 2 cards from the matter deck and 1 card from the industry sector deck. After the argument, the players vote for the best speech. The speech of the player with the most votes wins the round. At the end of 5 rounds the player with the most votes wins.

2 Players:

The player who draws the victory symbol (^) when rolling the Supreme Court die begins.

Two subject cards and one sector card are handed out to be able to elaborate your speech. You have one minute to present your speech.

The first player makes his speech and both vote for the best, in case of a draw, the dice is rolled to decide who wins the round.

In case of a tie with the dice, the round ends and 2 cards per player are drawn again to start a new round.
If there is a winner, the winning player scores a point for each round won. At the end of 5 rounds the player with the most points wins

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Math Rush: Multiplication & Exponents
Mathe-Sprint 2
boardgame.description:
Think fast in Math Rush, a totally thrilling cooperative math game that will make your heart race and your head rev. For three rounds, up to five players must balance strategy and speed, properly sequencing products and exponentials before the timer runs out. Crunch the numbers in a hurry and rack up more points; make an error and miss your goal. Whether you beat your high score or not, it's more fun that you calculated.

Math Rush is a timed, co-operative card game for 1-5 players who race to complete sets of matching cards in the right order.

In Math Rush: Multiplication & Exponents, the cards show products and exponentials that must be played in ascending or descending order, meeting the requirements of the goal cards (such as "Perfect Squares Only").

—description from the designer

listing.notes: Title: Math Rush: Multiplication & Exponents Publisher: Genius Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Math Rush: Fractions, Decimals, & Percents
Mathe-Sprint 3
boardgame.description:
Think fast in Math Rush, a totally thrilling cooperative math game that will make your heart race and your head rev. For three rounds, up to five players must balance strategy and speed, properly sequencing fractions, decimals, and percents before the timer runs out. Crunch the numbers in a hurry and rack up more points; make an error and miss your goal. Whether you beat your high score or not, it's more fun that you calculated.

Math Rush is a timed, co-operative card game for 1-5 players who race to complete sets of matching cards in the right order.

In Math Rush: Fractions, Decimals, & Percents, the cards show fractions, decimals, and percents that must be played in ascending or descending order, meeting the requirements of the goal cards (such as "Decimals Only").

—description from the designer

listing.notes: Title: Math Rush: Fractions, Decimals, & Percents Publisher: Genius Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Legends
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Where the waters of the Uttermost Sea flow across the Lost Arbonesse and enter the Nieder Straits, sailors’ hushed whispers and scraps torn from ancient nautical maps hint at a mysterious island, an ephemeral landmass that is sometimes here, sometimes there, sometimes nowhere to be found.

boardgame.name: Druids
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This enormous forest of pine and elm separates the Magdar Kingdom from the White Mountain Marches and was once part of the same elven lands as the Gennecka Forest to the east. As with other ancient forests of its size, the White Forest remains a relatively untamed place filled with beasts and the ruins of elven settlements, both of which occasionally attract explorers and willing adventurers. For the most part, the area is ignored or bypassed by travelers seeking an easier journey.

boardgame.name: The White Worg Accord
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

One year ago, the great dragon Visandred the Horse-Eater dropped from the sky and burned the once-famous Stannasgard shipyards and docks to ash. Many lost their fortunes that day, but one of the most crucial blows was suffered by the noble dwarf Wulfstan vom Meer whose fleet of merchant ships were nearly all docked at Stannasgard that day. Vom Meer lost every vessel save for one ship mercifully under sail at the time, and the once proud owner of a grand fleet now teeters on the brink of financial ruin.

boardgame.name: Death of a Mage
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Uvalius Odolin was little more than a minor, part-time lecturer in clockwork magic at the Collegium. His colleagues dismissed him as a mediocre academic, but as a devotee of clockwork magic and animated constructs, he tinkered day and night in his workshop.

boardgame.name: Legend of Beacon Rock
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Three millennia have passed since the island nation of Ankeshel sank beneath the waves of the Western Ocean. Legends speak of temples of solid orichalcum and the strange and powerful vril magic. When the small Palas family of shrimpers discovered the ruins of an ancient structure on Beacon Rock, north of Maillon, the City of Alchemy, rumors spoke of this being the fabled Lighthouse of the Sun, supposedly powered by an Undying Vril Battery. Despina Grave, head of the Grave Raiders, a ragtag band of discredited archeologists and mercenaries, convinced the family they would be paid handsomely if they guided the crew to the ruins. Unfortunately for the family, leading the crew there ended in betrayal with the father wounded, his wife on the run for help, and their son missing in the monster-infested ruins.

boardgame.name: Crystal Palace: Die Zeitungskarten
Crystal Palace: The Newspaper Cards
boardgame.description:
With this mini-expansion, the newspaper track on your player boards is replaced by newspaper cards, which with their diverse effects will provide even more variety in your games of Crystal Palace.

For now, this extension is only available as "Print and Play".

boardgame.name: Meta Olympia: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
In Meta Olympia, you play a Martian colony 'football' club in the not-too-distant future, playing rules that resemble soccer on Earth. The objective of the game is to be the most bad-ass team on the planet by achieving the most combined point. Player's teams are made up of athlete cards, each offensive, defensive or special abilities.

There are two different stages played over 4 rounds. In the Pre-Season phases, players take turns moving their miniatures forward along modular tiles. Each tile either helps players improve their team (via recruiting and trading athlete cards) or collecting resources that improve players tactical options.

In the tournament round, players get to to go head-to-head against each other in player vs player matches. Matches are played in 3 rounds where each player uses one athlete card and a die role per round. Players can also play tactics cards, resources earned from the pre-season phase, to buff or nerf.

Each round determines goals, saves, and potential injuries; with the final match result based on the final score of all 3 rounds.
As players move into the following stages, they have the resources to continually strengthen their team by adding higher-value players.

In tournament in stage 4 is the final championship. For 2 players, it is a best of 5 matches. For 3 or more players, it is a round robin. Players go all out to either defend their lead or challenge the leaders.

The final winner is determined by tallying up all the points collected, either through wins, game currency, or special resource cards.

-description from publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Evolution: Hard Shell Alternative Art
boardgame.description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

Alternative artwork for the "Hard Shell" card. Comes with 7 identical copies.

Text: This species gets +4 Body Size when determining if it can be attacked.

listing.notes:
NEW!
+Shipping Local pickup available from 92886
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.

Price: $12 + shipping (tracking required, inquire for quote)
Paypal and Venmo accepted.

boardgame.name: Daredevil
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box

He dwells in a world of eternal night but perceives things ordinary men cannot. Although Matt Murdock is blind, his other four senses function with superhuman sharpness. He is Daredevil, a masked vigilante stalking the daek streets of the city, a relentless avenger of justice. He is... The Man Without Fear

-Explore 23 levels set in NYC
-Battle 21 enemies including Marvel favorites such as Elecktra, Bullseye, and Kingpin
-Use Daredevil's signature weapon - the billy club
-Get the upper hand with unique radar sense
-Extras include movie stills, comic covers, alternate costumes, and more

boardgame.name: Xenohunters
boardgame.description:
It’s the 36th century, and the world's citizens live in station colonies throughout the galactic rim. However, colonies living on the outer galactic rim are going dark and have become uncontactable.

The galactic council has expended their military forces to no avail - they need to call on the best.

You, the Xenohunters, have been summoned as the elite mercenary crew who live on the edge of the law to investigate the stations. You know very well: this is another outbreak of flesh-eating Xenos, creatures that harvest living flesh to birth monsters.

The only way to stop this advancing tide of evil is with the liberal application of fire. The best way to do so: detonate the fusion reactors at the heart of every station. As elite mercenaries of the galaxy, your mission is clear: board the stations, destroy the reactors, and kill the aliens.

Good luck.

Warp ends in 3, 2, 1…

Xenohunters is a thematically engrossing board game of adventure and horror. One player becomes the terrifying flesh-eating Xeno, and all other players take control of the crew tasked with working together to hunt them down: Warlord, Ironclad, Caduceus, and Armature.

Both teams will hunt each other throughout the station, choosing when to reveal themselves and stay hidden. A hidden location grid behind your player screen conceals your movements until the time is right to strike.

Xenohunters collect powerful sci-fi equipment to hunt the Alien. However, rummaging around for equipment and supplies can be dangerous, as any mistake can lead to you appearing for all to see...

Meanwhile, as the Alien crawl through ducts, lay eggs, command your minions to search and distract and sense the humans to lay the perfect traps. And if you kill a Xenohunter? They become their own worst enemy... hatching from one of your eggs as a horrific Hybrid Spawn.

Comes with four Core Mission boards, 40 unique sci-fi gadgets, guns, explosions, and terrifying Hybrid Spawn.

boardgame.name: Plato's Fist
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Plato’s Fist is a simple core system for role playing in an occult multi-genre science fantasy setting.

∞

Nobody is rational. Rationality is over. The Glass Grimoire broke their minds by offering up echo-chamber tribalism as a replacement for religion. The obliteration of objective reality was just a byproduct.

Some were the size of a deck of cards, some were as large as renaissance paintings, but the hard windows of black glass all did the same thing: hijack an entity’s ego and reduce it to a witless drone.

But as any scribe of Farlore could tell you, time and time again the forces of tyranny can have been bent to liberation.

And so it is that, by way of the Glass Grimoire you read this on now, I impart this urgent message:

If humanity is to rise to its proper station in the multiverse it must remember how it once strode inward as readily as it now drives outward to the stars. The boldest of them must rediscover the mighty sheathes of their astral selves and stand once again — as the Atlanteans briefly did — amongst the gods of the planes within.

∞

"Until you showed up, Earth was the laughing stock of the cosmos.”

~ Banjoman, Lord of Limbo

boardgame.name: X-Men II: The Fall of the Mutants
boardgame.description:
From the Back of the Box

Based on an actual X-men adventure (issues 225-227), X-Men II: The Fall of the Mutants gives you complete control of the mutant crime fighters for exciting, strategy/arcade action.
- All five X-Men battle simultaneously in combat; you take control of any Super-Hero you want. Direct the attacks of one of your team members personally while issuing general orders to the rest. Real-time action and multiple opponents provide constant challenge.
- Nine Arch-Villains and six distinct groups of henchmen for the X-Men to overcome in each game, including Pyro, Stonewall, The Crimson Commander, Spiral and SuperSabre.
- Match your Super-Heroes against forces recruited by The Adversary from the Time: savage cave men, terrifying dinosaurs and ruthless modern day soldiers.
- Each game features 15 different locations where battles can be waged. These locations can remain the same, or be changed with each new game.

A fan-created rules conversion document to port the Tékumel setting to Talislanta (1st Edition).

boardgame.name: Marvel Super War
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Marvel Super War is a free-to-play, third person multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) game. Players select Marvel superheroes to fill characters roles on their team. The main objective is to destroy the other player's base. Players can go solo or with a group depending on player ranking and the game mode selected.

MARVEL Super War is currently available in countries and regions including South Korea, Japan, Australia, New Zealand, Thailand, the Philippines, Indonesia, Singapore, Malaysia, Vietnam, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Macao, and India. This game is not a global release title.

boardgame.name: Fast, Easy D100 Narrative Adventures for Empire of the Petal Throne
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A very lightweight game mechanic based on interpreting d% rolls without strict guidelines. The system is intended to support roleplaying in Tékumel.

From the introduction:

This gaming system is based on that described by Dr. Barker for his own gaming sessions (as described by Bob Alberti. The concept is to roll 1D100. The lower the roll, the better the outcome. For those desiring a little more detail, this system may be helpful. It is “fuzzy” and requires quick thinking and cooperation on the part of the referee and player(s).

boardgame.name: Cinematic Role-Playing
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Cinematic Role-Playing is a very lightweight game mechanic using either d10 or 2d6. The system is intended to support roleplaying in Tékumel.

From the introduction:

The basis for Cinematic Role-Playing is simple - if you want a scenario to be fun for everyone involved, the action and intrigue should flow like a movie.

boardgame.name: Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon
boardgame.description:
It is the eleventh entry in the Fire Emblem series, and is a remake of the Famicom title Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and the Blade of Light, the first installment in the series.

Shadow Dragon retells and expands on the events of Shadow Dragon and the Blade of Light. Set on the continent of Archanea, the story follows the tale of Marth, prince of the kingdom of Altea, who is sent on a quest to reclaim his throne after being forced into exile by the evil sorcerer Gharnef and his dark master Medeus, the titular Shadow Dragon. Forming new alliances with neighboring kingdoms, Marth must gather a new army to help him retrieve the sacred sword Falchion and the Fire Emblem shield in order to defeat Gharnef and Medeus and save his kingdom. The gameplay follows the established Fire Emblem formula of turn-based battles played out on grid-based maps. Returning features include a character class system which evolves based on character usage, and permanent death for units defeated in battle.

boardgame.name: Evolve
boardgame.description:
Evolve is an intriguing new family board game for those who want something a little more interesting than traditional board games. It has some educational content too. Its for ages 9+ to adults and can be played by 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 players in around 45 minutes. Great interaction between players as they try to gain the best habitat (Era cards) for their playing pieces and be first to create a path of six era cards (the habitat of creatures from bygone eras). Win by reaching the end card first with your playing piece. Era cards can gained in several ways including by an unusual auction (bid for habitat). All the while natural events (Thunderbolts) can spring up at random and hinder or sometimes help a player in his quest to reach the end of his/her path.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cryptid Cafe
boardgame.description:
You are a lead server at the Cryptid Cafe, a Sasquatch-owned restaurant packed with legendary creatures from all over the world. Gather food. Fill orders. Earn the most tips and be crowned, dare we say, the most "legendary" server.

Strategically dispatch your team of Sasquatch servers to the different food stations, gathering the much-needed items to complete your customers' orders.

As you serve the customers they will give you tips based on their satisfaction level. However, with each passing round, the Cryptids get more and more frustrated waiting for their food and will leave smaller tips. Eventually, they’ll leave the restaurant if they are not served fast enough. If that happens, plan on giving the owner some of your tips at the end of the night, he doesn't like to lose customers.

Sounds simple, right? Not so fast, because you’re not the only lead server working tonight. You'll be competing with other players who are trying to serve their customers as well. Spaces are limited. Food stations are breaking. The orders are piling up. Customers are getting angry! It may be wise to share some of your tips with the chef, so you get the food you need first. If all goes well, at the end of the night you'll be the player crowned the most legendary server.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Snowball Hostilities
boardgame.description:
In Snowball Hostilities players lead a team of kids against opponents in a series of wintry battles that take place in their backyard. Players can have their kids create, maintain, and transport a supply of snowballs and snow bricks as well as build snow walls for defense and snowmen that come to life and wreak havoc. Santa randomly appears in the game to drop presents that players can utilize such as snowmobiles, catapults, sleds, and a remote control airplane. To win players must sweep the other teams from the map or force them into resignation.

SEQUENCE OF PLAY
Each turn each kid, represented by a pawn, receives a number of action points. These can be used to move across the map, attack other players' kids, attempt to recruit new kids, or conduct other actions such as making, gathering, or transporting items. After players make their moves NPCs such as Santa, the elf, snowmen, and the dog will move randomly by roll of dice if they are on the map.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Handbook for the Recently Deceased
boardgame.description:
A game of hiding, seeking and spooking.

Inspired on the cult film Beetlejuice.


Released in the December 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


A lovely couple has died, and in a panic to save their home from the living family that's moved in and ruined everything, accidentally unleashed a dangerous ghost promising to rid the house of the living.

SETUP
Choose one player to be the Bio-Exorcist. You are a ghost, and you are trying to scare the living residents of this haunted house out, by moving items spookily around their house.

The other players leave the room to split up 2+ roles: 1 Occultist, 1 Goth, and 0-3 Folks.

While they're gone, the Bio-Exorcist moves as many objects as the number of living players, and hides a spook (represented by a card or a coin) under each one:

One spook is the postcard, The Handbook for the Recently Deceased.
One spook (the joker or the largest coin) is Scared to Death.
The rest of the spooks are the love of the ghost couple.


SPOOKING OBJECTS
An object you spook must be noticeable moved from where it started. To mess with their heads, the Bio-Exorcist may also move 3 more objects without hiding any spooks under them.

It's important that the Bio-Exorcist remembers where they put each card/coin. Record this info, if needed.

Finally, the Bio-Exorcist calls back the living and the game can begin.

PLAYING THE GAME
Each living player may ask one question of the Bio-Exorcist and may peek under one object. They may do this in any order, at any time; there are no turns.

The Bio-Exorcist must answer questions truthfully, but may interpret ambiguous wording as they please. They cannot speak, they answer only with knocks: once for "yes", don't knock for "no", in numbers knocking that many times.

When a living player peeks and finds a spook, they reveal it and earn another question and another peek.

WINNING AND LOSING
Anyone who reveals Scared to Death loses the game immediately.

If the Goth reveals the Handbook for the Recently Deceased, they get to fulfill their dream of becoming a ghost. The Goth and the Bio-Exorcist win.

If the Occultist reveals the Handbook for the Recently Deceased, they exorcise the Bio-Exorcist and the ghost couple. The Occultist and the Folks win.

If all of the love spooks are revealed, the ghost couple and the living become friends, and get rid of the Bio-Exorcist. All of the living players win.

If no one has any peeks left and there are love spooks unfound, the living have been driven from the house. The Bio-Exorcist wins.

boardgame.name: Trick or Repeat
boardgame.description:
A time-travelling trick taking card game.

Inspired on the cult film Donnie Darko.


Released in the October 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


SETUP
Deal 5 cards to each player face down. Form the Rabbit by dealing 5 cards face up in the center of the table, stacked bottom to top with all cards visible. The face up cards in the Rabbit set the trump suit in the five tricks to be played, in order from top to bottom.

RULES

1. Form timelines. Choose a card from your hand, place it face down in front of you. Then pass the remaining cards to the left, and repeat, placing later cards closer to the Rabbit to form a line extending from yourself, until all cards have been placed, in the order labeled Form Timeline. Do not look at the last card passed to you.

2. Predict the future. At the count of three, bid simultaneously on the number of tricks the player to your left will win.

3. Resolve tricks. In the order labeled Resolve Tricks, everyone reveals the next card in their timelines, and evaluate the trick. In the first trick, the player to the left of the dealer leads, and thereafter the player who won the previous trick leads. A trick is won by the highest card matching the lead player's suit, unless cards matching the suit of the current Rabbit card have been played, in which case the highest card in the Rabbit suit wins.

4. Score points. After all 5 tricks have been played, score points: 1 point for each won trick, and an additional 2 points for having correctly bid the number of tricks won by the player to your left.

TIME TRAVEL
After scoring once, the game "goes back in time". Pick up the last card in your timeline, labeled Time Travel. Then, moving towards the Rabbit, pick up 1 card at a time and place it on top of the others in your hand. Keep the cards face up when collecting and passing. Finally, starting with yourself, take the top card and pass the remaining cards to your right. Repeat until each player has 5 cards, the same cards they had at the beginning of the game.

WINNING
Add up scores from the two rounds to determine a winner.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars - Prelude

As the megacorporations are getting ready to start the terraforming process, you now have the chance to make those early choices that will come to define your corporation and set the course for the future history of Mars. This is the prelude to your greatest endeavors!

boardgame.name: Monsters from Mystical Lands Volume 1: Humanoids and Undead
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enormous giants! Bone chilling ghosts! New playable races and dread necrotic villains!

The first volume of Monsters from Mystical Lands presents Humanoids and the Undead, comprising two important expansions to the For Gold & Glory bestiary. You'll find 26 new humanoids, 11 of them playable, and 24 new undead horrors to face. Also included is what might be the most complete treatise on undead ever found in a roleplaying game.

With official rule expansions, 51 creatures, and over 50 professional illustrations packed into 100 pages, Monsters from Mystical Lands Volume 1 is a book that no GM will want to do without.
boardgame.rpg: For Gold & Glory: Old School Roleplaying

boardgame.name: The Adventurer's Guide to Lost Arcana
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inside this tome, you will find the Lost Arcana hidden from Adventurers and Players alike for nearly half a century. Buried with the moldy pages of the prized books of a bygone era, this tome faithfully reconstructs and re-presents spells that were once lost and are now ready to find a place in every wizard's spell book and in every cleric's faith. Welcome back the magic of a forgotten era of spells & prayers!
boardgame.rpg: For Gold & Glory: Old School Roleplaying

boardgame.name: The Adventurers' Guide to the Practical Application of Herbalism & Alchemy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Follow the continuing adventures of the Delvers as they explore the ruins of the ancient Alchemists' Guildhall. Be there when they discover the Alchemists' greatest lost secrets and meet with their wealthy and mysterious benefactor, Servius Linnus... A licensed "For Gold & Glory" supplement written by the editor of the game with over 34,000 words, this heavily illustrated guide for old school RPGs is packed with useful material for players and GMs alike to enjoy in almost any magical, medieval, fantasy game based upon the "World's Most Popular Role Playing Game". Each item entry is described with recipes, costs and specific game effects.
boardgame.rpg: For Gold & Glory: Old School Roleplaying

boardgame.name: System V
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 12 page supplement provides Game Masters and Players of the For Gold & Glory second edition game with a new ability score called "appearance", a new method for rolling ability scores and new rules for level limitations. It also expands the game with rules for new race and class combinations, human multi-classing, and new multi-class option
boardgame.rpg: For Gold & Glory: Old School Roleplaying

boardgame.name: The Lost Halls of Scarnascis (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lost Halls of Scarnascis is a DUNGEONS & DRAGONS 5e adventure for 3-5 characters of 3rd level. It is designed to be played in a single session.

The party has found a magical treasure map. For the map to reveal its secrets, in magical text, it states that they must swear a pact of companionship over personal interest, of generosity over greed, and harmony over discord.

boardgame.name: Graves Left Wanting
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your last adventure left you less than alive... or so you thought. Awakening from dreamful slumber, you find yourself at the bottom of a corpse pit. Around you, blood-caked and very much expired vessels of more fortunate souls. Towering above you, forests of wilting gravestones and entrances to ancient tombs. The air is stagnant, yet repulsive. Tepid, yet bone-chilling. As strange as the reasons for your revitalization may be, instinct ⎯ if nothing else ⎯ wills you to give life another go. To survive for a while longer as you make your escape from GRAVES LEFT WANTING.

This adventure takes PCs on an exciting romp among, and below, the tombstones of Graven-Tosk. Intended as a post-TPK scenario, or as the starting point of a new miserable campaign.

boardgame.name: Fur-bulous Five
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From across the globe, a group of anthropomorphic adventurers fight to defend their people or end suppression. These brave warriors are known as the Fur-bulous Five! This book details these five heroes including an arctic hare ranger, a corgi paladin, a fox sorcerer, a raccoon samurai, and a red panda monk. These characters range from level 5-13 and can be used as opponents or allies in your campaign world or ours.

boardgame.name: Tiny Outlands
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can You Survive at the Edge of the Galaxy?

When mankind pushed into the stars, it wasn't the government that led the way, it was the corporations. There was plenty of room for everyone, right up until the first alien ruins were discovered, and the secrets inside them sparked the wide-ranging Corporate War, the effects of which are still being felt all throughout the galaxy. It's only on the borders of civilized space, the Outlands, where a man can truly be free. And, coincidentally, it's in the Outlands where the last untapped ruins are hidden away, hungrily sought by greedy corporations and independent Tombseekers alike!

Tiny Outlands is a campaign and setting enhancement for the Tiny Frontiers: Revised Edition role-playing game. It adds all the tools necessary for an over-the-top science fiction campaign filled with glorious loot and hyper-violence! Create your adventurer from one of the different heritages, including the ever-present humans, the doomed mutants, the mysterious enigmas, or even the neurotic, impossibly annoying robotic B0M units! Take up the mantle of a Tombseeker or become one of the mysterious Starborne, wielding the power of the universe itself as you go up against bloodthirsty alien beasts, the psychotic dregs of humanity left in the wake of the war, extremely well-equipped corporate security forces, or anything else the galaxy might throw at you!

Lock and load, killer. It's time to get paid!

boardgame.name: Europaeisches Reisespiel
boardgame.description:
"European travel game" published by Ernst Kuhn, Switzerland, 1892.
Typical roll and move game. First player, who completes the route wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Letterbound
boardgame.description:
A word game that can be played alone or with friends.

Players work together for a high score by forming tough words, but they cannot communicate during their turns. On each player's turn they will say a word outloud that includes at least 2 different letters that are currently shown on the board (and not covered).

Then they'll choose one of the letters in that word and place a penny on it, heads side up. If the word includes 3 different letters fromm the board, then the penny is placed tails side up.

The game ends immediately when one letter remains or a player cannot say a word that uses two letters. The last word cannot include a red letter.

SCORE: The blue outside spaces are worth one point and the purple inside spaces are worth two points. Any spaces with tails are worth one extra point.

boardgame.name: Vindication: Chronicles
boardgame.description:
The road to restoring your lost honor goes deeper with Chronicles, the second expansion to Vindication. Chronicles adds more narrative, immersion, and story to the existing Vindication experience, both for the island itself and for your own personal journey.

Narrative-choice chronicle cards add a layer of decision and intrigue that bring your story to life. Each time you gain a card in the game (companion, relic, trait, monster, pet, etc) another player will draw and read a chronicle card, which presents you with a narrative prompt and a decision, ultimately telling the story of how you obtained that card. As you grow your tableau, so too do you chronicle your own journey.

These decisions are further recorded on new, large, full color paper player sheets. Make enough decisions embodying a certain attribute and you become legendary for that attribute, gaining you a powerful new ability and a big gorgeous tarot card to place next to your wretch tile to help you feel extra good about your progress.

All the while, you must confront various global events that rage across the land. At times no one may visit an inn until all the bandits have been run off. Strange mists may make traveling the edge of the map extra perilous. Dozens of unique events change the game state in some dynamic way — until someone deals with it and claims a huge reward.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Last Barrow
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

In ages long past someone built a barrow for a prince, and laid him to rest--or so they thought. The bodies of his wife and a few of his descendants found their way there as well before the barrow fell into disuse and was in time forgotten. And now, perhaps, after centuries have slipped by, the hour may have arrived for the prince to return, and with him relics of great power.

Set in the Known World--setting of the ARTESIA graphic novels and the novel THE BARROW--but suitable for use in almost any fantasy world with minimal adaptation, THE LAST BARROW details the paths to a hidden barrow mound, the stone circle that sits atop it, its various contents, and the dark presence that awaits within. It includes several appendices with statistics and suggested rules to allow use of the scenario with:

the ARTESIA: ADVENTURES IN THE KNOWN WORLD roleplaying game;
the 5th Edition of the World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game (published as Open Game Content); and
the current edition of RuneQuest from Chaosium.
A digital art and map pack is also included as a separate download, for use as handouts to players.
boardgame.rpg: Artesia: Adventures In The Known World

boardgame.name: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth – Shadowed Paths Expansion: Broken Token Organizer Upgrade
The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth – Shadowed Paths Expansion: Untold Journeys Shadowed Path Upgrade
boardgame.description:
You have no memory of this place; darkened caverns, solemn dungeons, ancient evils. Illuminate the darkness with this organizer upgrade to support the Shadowed Paths expansion for The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle Earth combined with our Untold Journeys Organizer (sold separately). This add-on includes three new, removable trays. An additional map tile tray, featuring a foreboding figurehead, holds all the new map tiles. You shall not pass up the custom fit Balrog miniature tray and terrain tray which holds the new terrain tokens, a designated place for terrain cards, and room for more. This add-on must be combined with the Untold Journeys Organizer (ORG117). in order to store all the components and will add 40 mm of lid lift. The add-on can be stored in the expansion box, but does not fill the box. Future add-ons will fill that space, so you might want to hold on to both boxes if you're opposed to lid lift.

Dimensions: 11.25" x 11.25" x 1.57" (286mm x 286mm x 40mm)

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth – Shadowed Paths Expansion

boardgame.name: Mitos y Leyendas: Guerrero Jaguar
boardgame.description:
"The Jaguar moves slowly, but its claws do not know mercy. Whoever moves through the jungle is the true master of life, the holder of the keys of death; the creator of a new tomorrow."

Guerrero Jaguar introduces the exciting stories of Mesoamerican mythology to the world of Myths and Legends. Discover exciting new strategies with this 236-card edition fully compatible with all previous Second Era editions.

This deck contains 50 tactical cards (5 Royals, 15 Courtesans, 15 Vassals and 15 Golds), mixed randomly, to enhance the highest Mythological strategies. Includes instructions for updated Rules. Recommended product for high level players.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

"El Jaguar se mueve despacio, pero sus garras no conocen la piedad. Quien se mueve entre la selva, es el verdadero amo de la vida, el poseedor de las llaves de la muerte; el creador de un nuevo mañana".

Guerrero Jaguar introduce al mundo de Mitos y Leyendas las emocionantes historias de la mitología Mesoamericana. Descubre nuevas y emocionantes estrategias con esta edición de 236 cartas totalmente compatibles con todas las ediciones anteriores de Segunda Era.

Este mazo contiene 50 cartas tácticas (5 Reales, 15 Cortesanas, 15 Vasallos y 15 Oros), mezcladas aleatoriamente, para potenciar las más altas estrategias Mitológicas. Incluye instructivo de Reglas actualizadas. Producto recomendado para jugadores de Alto Nivel.

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Mitos y Leyendas: Guerrero Jaguar – Punta de Lanza
boardgame.description:
"The attack is the most effective defense, this is how we will attack constantly, until we break the tips of our spears, there will be no glory if there is no victory."

Guerrero Jaguar introduces the exciting stories of Mesoamerican mythology to the world of Myths and Legends. Discover exciting new strategies with this 236-card edition fully compatible with all previous Second Era editions.

This pre-built deck contains 50 tactical cards (4 Royals, 15 Courtiers, 16 Vassals, and 15 Golds) that power your Myths and Legends strategy. A rule book is included. The actual cards included in this deck do not appear in the improvement packs. Deck specially designed for Myths and Legends players who wish to perfect and learn new strategies.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

"El ataque es la defensa más efectiva, es así como atacaremos constantemente, hasta romper las puntas de nuestras lanzas, no habrá gloria si no hay victoria".

Guerrero Jaguar introduce al mundo de Mitos y Leyendas las emocionantes historias de la mitología Mesoamericana. Descubre nuevas y emocionantes estrategias con esta edición de 236 cartas totalmente compatibles con todas las ediciones anteriores de Segunda Era.

Este mazo preconstruido contiene 50 cartas tácticas (4 Reales, 15 Cortesanos, 16 Vasallos y 15 Oros) que potencian tu estrategia de Mitos y Leyendas. Se incluye un libro de reglas. Las cartas reales incluidas en este mazo no aparecen en los sobres de superación. Mazo especialmente diseñado para jugadores de Mitos y Leyendas que deseen perfeccionar y conocer nuevas estrategias.

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: The Isle of Cats: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
Insert compatible with The Isle of Cats, including the Late Arrivals and Kickstarter Pack expansions. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 29.8 x 29.8 x 10.3 cm.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Isle of Cats: Kickstarter Pack
The Isle of Cats: Late Arrivals

boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Ironsmith Medieval Simulator
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Step into the Medieval world and become a blacksmith.User Summary

boardgame.name: Kainga
Kainga: Seeds of Civilization
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Kainga is ancient village builder set in a fantasy world full of surprises. Adaptation is key where weather events, massive beasts or other tribes can easily erase you from history. Every time you play, your village's culture, technology, and look will be different depending on your surroundings, environment, climate, altitude and the resources available to you. Design a unique town with every play-through, based on your resources and limitations. Instead of overpowering your obstacles - can you learn to live in harmony with them?Features
This is a Roguelike Village Builder: death is a permanent and looming threat, but the lessons you learn and the technology you discover may allow your next settlement to succeed.


Lively, retro mix of 2D characters and a 3D world.
A bizarre and fantastical environment, creatures and ideas.
Create a unique culture with every playthrough, adapt to your surroundings, combine technology with unexpected results.
A slow, weak "Thinker" discovers new technology and is critical to your village. The Thinker must be protected at all costs, much like a king in chess.
Discover new lands, unlock technology, and free more Thinkers to increase the complexity and variety of future runs.


Source: The Game Press Kit.
